reviewDescription: I've had this now for about a week. I bought it to check in on my new puppy while I'm at work. I'm rating it a 3 because I'll admit, the picture quality is far better than I imagined. I was floored when I saw how good the night vision is! Excellent picture all around .... When it works, that is.I haven't had a second to purchase an SD card, so perhaps the experience will improve once I get that far. As for now, I turn it on before I leave in the morning and turn it off when I get home (the constant notifications drive me crazy with the puppy running around in front of it and I'm not quite sure i want to see a 👻 when I'm in bed lol). But I've found, it glitches A LOT. I have a 20 minute commute and by the time I get to work, it's already cut off. I'm often having to turn it back on. It's rare that I can get the live feed. I'm constantly having to get out of the app and back in again to hopefully force it to work - sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. My internet connection is always incredibly good so I don't think it's that, as is my mobile data (IDK if one has anything to do with the other 🤷🏻‍♀️).It's actually a good camera and easy to use. So I'm going to try the SD card and it that doesn't work, I will buy something different.

I can't tell how the camera works because I cannot link it to my existing account. Unfortunately, my old Kasa broke (after two years). I decided to purchase the pan/tilt for a better experience (hopefully longer). I have not had success replacing it on my already paid for subscription of Kasa Care. They are asking for me to pay more money to add it when I've paid up until March of next year. Customer service is only through email and given the number of misspellings, I think it is AI. I have not been able to speak or chat with a live person as it always refers me back to email. I will not purchase from them again.*Update: I was contacted by customer service and the issue was resolved for one of my cameras. It still was a difficult process, but I am satisfied with the response.

There is a little bit of a lag to the video but it works great to monitor my pups that I keep crated when I leave. One of them is a husky so knowing I have eyes on my escape artist is always a relief.The one downside is that it says there should be an SD slot and I’ve yet to find it. But the set up was easy. It also has night vision.It’s also easy to zoom in on the camera. I thought that was pretty neat.

I like the panning, zoom and motion alert features; and the app is pretty responsive, even on my older device. The camera only has the ability to record 24hours/continuously; it does NOT have ability to only record when motion is detected. The camera also won't let you view motion alert activity without a cloud subscription (even if you have an SD card installed). Had I known what the camera can't do (with no additional cost), I would not have purchased it. And if I need/want another camera, I wouldn't buy this again.

Pretty easy to install and the app is simple enough. I can see everything during the dark. However, there are 4 viewpoints you can set so the camera automatically repositions to the set point when tapped. Ive noticed that these viewpoints will change locations, meaning I have to go back and reset them to the original location each time, and resave them. I’ve slowly stopped using this camera due to how frustrating it is.

reviewTitle: 2K: Narrower field of view, negligible picture difference
reviewDescription: I own both the 2K and standard versions of this device. The 2K version of this device surprisingly has a narrower field of view, meaning there is less picture captured around the perimeter of the image than the standard version.The picture difference between the 2K and standard version is insignificant. The 2K version offers significantly more digital zoom within the app, and objects at distance are slightly clearer.The devices are good and the app is not bad. The devices struggle a bit with connectivity even at a moderate distance from an access point, leading to some stalls within the app.Advanced users: These devices require access to WAN. I have blocked them from internet and attempted accessing them on my local network. I can rotate the camera, but no image is returned. It seems all image communication within the app is external. The only traffic between this device and the outside world are two AWS addresses. The addresses DO have a web page stating they belong to Kasa, but nothing stops a bad actor from getting an AWS address and discretely mimicing this behavior to MITM traffic should a vulnerability be discovered.You are NOT forced to use cloud storage with these devices. They take a microSD card.Overall, I will continue buying these, but not the 2K versions.

I had bought these previously and loved them and when I moved I left them at the old house. Ended up buying them again, and just disappointing.  Mainly the cord is junky now. Not the USB plug type and white cable, it's just a basic black wire cable. Looks awful you have get a cord cover to hide it.

Video is great for the price but when speaking through the camera the audio is horrible. Can’t hear a thing when playing back the video which really sucks but other than that it’s great. Set up was easy and I’m so glad I’ll be able to check in on my fur baby while at work

reviewTitle: Great options but resolution terrible and pay for storage monthly
reviewDescription: Love that it can tilt and pan, but doesn’t tilt up and down that much, love that it can record 24-7 but have to pay monthly, and love that you can speak through app but audio quality and delay not good, and finally, resolution is terrible. To be fair, for the cost it’s probably not bad. But if you account for monthly fee forever, it may not be cost effective. You have to buy a chip/card if you want it to record. And also I thought it would automatically track movement and move on its own, but it doesn’t. Oh, and moving the camera from the app is slow, limited, and cumbersome. Love features, dislike execution and quality.

I bought this on 5-9-22 and by 6-16 it had stopped working as well. The monthly subscription plan was impossible to find. At one point I got an message in the kasa app about how I can be notified by email when my kasa is turned off daily, but despite it being a good idea I waited, and when I couldn't find the option, kasa customer service in taiwan denied any and all involvement with such a message or feature.On 6-16, a month in, the kasa camera developed an over 60 second delay between the cell phone video shown and the actual direction the camera was pointed. In the same day, my blink mini read 'backup failed for 'MTWTrF'.Almost every time, when arriving home, turning off the kasa camera that had detected my motion and that was pointed at me correctly, took minutes. The app is slow, and the off button takes more than a few presses for camera to turn off. In actually checking the feed, to see if there was any recorded motion while away, the camera often took another minute to load that specific window.The app sort of makes sense, and for $29, and no monthly cost for the camera to operate, its ok. But getting the video off it is harder, while the monthly subscription is hard to find.In signing up for the subscription, $3 is missing from my account monthly, but there isn't a registered transaction that I can find. This implies I have to work with their tech support or replace the initial pan tilt.///More than a year later, the kasa pan tilt still works, but I worry of increases in small problems from a better review. What stands out is the app, and related gadgets. The app itself looks really smart, from scheduled on and off patterns. The kasa pan tilt goes well with kasa light strips, and there are a ton of scheduled features possible that integrate the camera with lights.But, despite the app being quite smart, and well integrated with other devices that similarly work, the pan tilt app could use a lot more smart features in the app. There could be a more complex schedule, so that the pan tilt could turn on at approximately 9 am, and switch to a different area of the room every 10 minutes, with changes in camera direction happening at controllable increments.As it is, its possible to schedule turn on the camera, so it reacts to and tracks motion, and put it in a patrol mode, but its not possible to auto schedule a shifting array. Its not possible to tune the camera so it tracks and follow motion between 9 am and 5 pm, but turn off the track and follow feature once I am likely to get in. Nor it it possible to schedule the camera to patrol the room once an hour, to save the motor.

reviewTitle: Should Have Read More Reviews.....Disappointed is an understatement..
reviewDescription: I want to preface this review by saying I was excited to find a camera with a budget friendly cost and a good amount of positive reviews, so I was hopeful...Review for: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera EC70I purchased this camera on August 17th 2023, it delivered on August 27th. I did not subscribe as I did not want my information stored anywhere, so I purchased memory cards separately. Upon receiving the camera, I was quickly up and running, the instructions were clear and I was able to follow them without any concerns. The camera worked beautifully, seamlessly, and clear, for roughly 2 months. On October 22nd 2023, I started noticing glitches in the streaming and an extremely long time loading. I want to note that my household runs SOLELY on a wifi network and because of this, I am equipped to handle various devices and have a very strong connection. No other device in my household has encountered such problems.Finally after a few hours of glitches and loading issues, I went into "settings" on the Kasa App to help diagnose a problem. Turns out my camera was offline. SHOCKER. After the app prompted me through the laundry list of troubleshooting, I completed this list SEVERAL times. I reset, I unplugged, I reset again, I removed device, I re-added device, reset my home router, still to no avail. Literally, hours spent trying to figure out how to make my camera reconnect. I even went as far as to call my internet service provider to see if there was an outage, even though ALL OTHER devices in my home were streaming perfectly, my phone was working, and appliances were connected. I know, crazy, if I would have had an issue with my home wifi, I am certain any other device or ALL would have issues. But no just this camera.I reached out to the customer service team via email and provided a thorough & detailed explanation of the issues I was having , and they responded with asking me to provide a "small video about the APP slow to load." whatever that means. They provided a link for trouble shooting, and if that still didn't work then I would have to send another email telling them in detail what steps I followed. Which I very much explained in my initial email. I went through ALL troubleshooting steps again, close now to 20 times and was able to get connection but it was somehow worse than before. I emailed them telling them step-by-step, and even told them I wasn't sure why I needed to re-explain the steps I am taking when they are the EXACT same. Granted this camera did not cost me my life savings, but it should work longer than 2 months. They responded telling me to download A WHOLE OTHER APP and follow the steps in the email in the app and send back the files collected, as if I am part of their IT team? HECK NO. I will not download another app and send back "files" just to not have resolution again. Who knows what data is collected during that process.I am almost embarrassed how frustrated I am with this whole thing. I really just wanted to put my experience out there so someone else doesn't have to deal with the bull I just went through. Do not contact customer service, they are NO help, and only send emails during witching hour.I am eating the cost of this camera and know now to better invest in my future purchase.I DO NOT suggest this camera, READ all reviews, good and bad.

reviewTitle: Possible FRAUD to lure you into "tech support" with full access to your PC and router
reviewDescription: I bought this camera Kasa EC71 as replacement for Tapo C211 (apparently the same camera maybe manufactured in diff facilities and sold under different model number). Both cameras are controlled by the same mobile app.The first camera stopped working after 2-3 days. When I tried to reset it, the app reported it as already configured failing to add as active device. I returned Tapo C211, uninstalled mobile app and got Kasa EC71.Trying to setup EC71 I installed the mobile app again (where I already had account). However, I got the same error from the app - already configured. This time I decided to seek for tech support. I spent 2 hours getting through the same reset/setup process with technician on chat. At some point he suggested to check and modify DNS configuration on my router. That triggered my suspicion - is it common for average consumer to even know what the router is. Anyway, I checked the router setting - camera was listed in router devices but not recognized by the mobile app.Once the chat ended, I got email from tech support suggesting "It has the possibility of the compatible issue causing the connection issue, that's why we want to check the router settings.... please install Teamviewer on Windows PC and send me the ID and password... Please enable all three options of Screen Recording, Accessibility, and Full Disk Access."Having 20+ years background in computer programming I have a feeling that this is just to invite hackers on your PC and router. They will make camera to work, but now they also have all IP/MAC info to get access to it via router and potentially watch you without your knowledge at least or gain control over other devices in your network.Is it expectation that people without any computer background will follow these "recommendations" to set up $25 camera intended for non-technical consumers?The bottom line - do not buy, do not follow with "tech support" - waste of time and very possible attempt to fraud you.

reviewTitle: Terrible Experience with the Kasa Pan/Tilt Camera
reviewDescription: : Terrible Experience with the Kasa Pan/Tilt CameraI recently purchased the Kasa Pan/Tilt Camera and I must say, it has been an absolute disappointment. From the moment I set it up, I encountered numerous issues that have made me regret my decision to purchase this product.First and foremost, the camera's pan and tilt functionality is extremely unreliable. It often fails to respond to commands, leaving me unable to adjust the camera's view remotely. This defeats the purpose of having a pan/tilt camera in the first place. I expected smooth and seamless control, but instead, I am left frustrated and unable to monitor different areas of my home effectively.Furthermore, the camera's video quality is subpar at best. Despite boasting high-definition capabilities, the footage captured by the Kasa Pan/Tilt Camera is grainy and lacks clarity. It is nearly impossible to make out any details, making it useless for identifying faces or objects. I expected a much better image quality for the price I paid.Another major issue I encountered is the camera's connectivity problems. It frequently disconnects from the Wi-Fi network, making it unreliable for continuous monitoring. I have tried troubleshooting the issue multiple times, but the problem persists. This is a major flaw, as I rely on the camera for security purposes and need it to be consistently connected.Additionally, the Kasa Pan/Tilt Camera lacks essential features that are standard in other security cameras on the market. For instance, there is no two-way audio capability, which means I cannot communicate with anyone on the other end of the camera. This is a significant drawback, as it limits the camera's functionality and usefulness.Overall, my experience with the Kasa Pan/Tilt Camera has been nothing short of frustrating and disappointing. The unreliable pan and tilt functionality, poor video quality, frequent connectivity issues, and lack of essential features make this product a complete letdown. I would strongly advise against purchasing this camera if you are looking for a reliable and high-quality security solution.

reviewTitle: Piece of crap. I don't know why this has positive reviews
reviewDescription: The software is lagging and buggy. I can only open the app and see the live view successfully maybe a third of the time. It's incredibly slow to connect, and most of the time I get a "call timed out" message at the bottom, along with an occasional Javascript failure error. And forget about panning or even trying to navigate to one of my saved "views." The app lags to the point where I can't even change the basic settings. Just getting into the menu has the little progress wheel spinning endlessly. If I try to even navigate out, it basically freezes. I've had to force stop this app so many times. I even restarted my phone. I put a microSD in the camera, by the way, but I can't even get to a setting where I can see that it's installed properly and working.And it's not my phone or wifi. My phone is a Samsung galaxy s22+ and has never had a problem running any app I've downloaded - except this one - and my wifi has never had a problem connecting to anything - and I have a decent amount of smart things.All I wanted to do was have a camera that I could use to occasionally look in on my crated dogs to make sure they were OK. This is the simplest task I could ask this camera to do and it fails miserably. At this point, I might as well just buy another freaking doorbell camera. It can't pan, but it actually works, unlike this waste of money and electricity. Oh, yes, it's a waste of electricity because it won't even let me turn it off from the app! It linked to Google Home successfully, but I can't even power it on or off from there. Once again, it just spins endlessly!Oh, and there's no household support, meaning that if you want your SO to have access, you need to turn off 2-factor and give them your sign-in info so that it's both of you signed into one account. (And the lagging and bugs happened BEFORE I gave my husband my login info, so it's not two people being signed in that's the problem.)The more I think about this, the more frustrating it is. Save yourself the irritation and find something else.

I will be returning these useless cameras ASAP! I initially got them for 2 reasons, 1, I wanted more pan and tilt cameras like my old Zmodo ones. They don't make them anymore, so I thought these were the next best option because reason 2, I love my Kasa smart plugs and switches. I thought it'd be great to have everything on one app!Well, got them and set them up right out of the box with few issues. At first it was user error because I didn't plug the USB cord all the way into the wall plug. (Duh!) After that was fixed, set up was a breeze, just like my other Kasa products! Everything worked great! I set up the zones, which was a brilliant feature and it followed movement. I also loved how you could set 4 different views and toggle the camera between them to get quick views. They were a dream!Fast forward a few hours, and I was getting movement alerts and I thought, "Ooo! I wonder what my cats are up to!" Clicked on the notification and it took me to the camera part in the app, but there was no video to look at! I clicked on the tab where the clips are supposed to be and nothing. Nothing on the notifications. Okay, thought it was odd, but we'd give it a fair shake. Maybe it was a fluke. Nope! Every time it was set off, I couldn't retrieve any clips. Annoying. What's the point if you can only see it live? I let it go until the next day. I went to the app to see the camera views and they were offline. Okay, weird. Maybe my wifi was acting up. Checked again later. Still nothing but a blinking green light, which supposedly means that it is hooked up to the wifi, but can't access the cloud, and therefore, can't access the app. Annoying. Tonight, I tried about 57 times to get it back online. I did a soft reset. I unplugged it and plugged it back in. I did a factory reset. I deleted it from the app and tried putting it back on. I did all of these multiple times to no avail. I have 2 worthless pieces of plastic now unplugged, sitting on my table ready to be sent back. Do yourself a favor and avoid these junk cameras. It's not worth the headache. Also, if they own your video/feed, that's a big no-no. I don't want them looking in my home whenever. What if I'm running to the laundry room in my underwear to get a clean pair of pants?! I don't want anyone to see that! Also, I haven't left the house since I've set them up, so I can't confirm or deny weather or not they work outside of the home wifi. I know others had this issue, but I never got to test it. So, overall, great concept, poor execution, and extremely poor TOU.

reviewTitle: Stop working in less than two month
reviewDescription: UPDATE - I'd have given zero star if it's an available option.  The camera I purchased and received on 12/16/23 suddenly went offline in less than two months and would not connect again although I followed the instructions, multiple times, and then went back and forth with TP-Link Support, followed their instructions and multiple different steps, and it still would not connect. Finally they agreed to send a replacement, but it's refurbished not new, the warranty period would be the original purchase date not the replacement date, and I would have to pay for return shipping and only after they receive it that they would ship the replacement. Why would I spend $10 to ship back the FACULTY product (they called it FACULTY) that cost less than $30, can't guarantee they'd actually ship a replacement and if they do, it's a refurbished product that they would not even guarantee it would definitely work without any issues? What a joke!Original review: I recently adopted a cat. She hid almost all the time underneath my couch. I wanted to see if she'd be out and what she'd do in the middle of the night and decided to give this camera a try. I'm so glad I did. It's fun to watch her playing with her toys and exploring the house. The camera is very easy to set up and takes pretty clear videos, and the app has many options. I like how I can store the recordings on micro SD card instead of paying for cloud storage, and I can set up the schedule to have the camera on only certain hours. It is very easy to save clips and photos to my phone using the app. The price is very reasonable too. I like it so much I bought a 2nd one already. Definitely recommend.

Pros: cheap, great for indoor babies monitoring, has night vision, 360 degrees horizontal 113 vertical rotations, can store data in micro sd card up to 256 GB or pay for cloudCons: No battery! I would've paid $10 more for a battery version. Without battery, it simply means that it's hard to change its location and it won't work without electricity.Noisy rotation! It's definitely not a stealth camera because there's no way to hide its noise and lights.Sluggish tracking! The latency is quite high to track a kid who's walking fast.Bought 2k QHD but still not looking that good.Overall: Great camera for very light monitoring on house and kids. I'd advise you to make sure that your router has 2.4 ghz wifi before buying this device which works only on 2.4 ghz. If not, you'll need to buy a wifi converter(I bought the Atomi Smart Wifi 2.4 ghz converter). It'll save you time and money on buying a new router or trying cheap tricks that won't work.Update(1/31/2024): There's an option to turn off its lights on the app.My camera can't reconnect when the power goes out for more than 5 minutes or when the memory card is full. The worse part is that it can stop saving  data without you knowing it. From November 2023 to January 2024, the camera wasn't saving anything locally until I tried to review some recordings and found out that it wasn't recording for several months when the memory card was still there without issue. I'll take off 1 star for this problem.Update May 5 2024: The camera kept being disconnected from internet and for the past week despite several troubleshootings, now I can't get it to connect anymore.So, this junk is of no use after 15 months.When I bought it, I gave it 4 stars because there was no battery and after 9 months 3 stars because it stopped recording and after 15 months I gave it 1 star because it's not connecting anymore and without connection, the whole camera is useless. A disappointing camera that couldn't even last 2 year by just staying on a desk.

reviewTitle: Do NOT waste Your Money on this Camera - It Dissapears from Your Account Constantly
reviewDescription: This should have been a wonderful camera but it DOES NOT WORK. I have installed it about 10 times. It works perfectly - for about 10 minutes. Then it removes the camera from the account and tells me I have no devices. It gives me meaningless error messages such as "This device is no longer associated with its previous account." WHY? I have only ever had one account and have only ever linked this camera to one account. THERE IS NO PREVIOUS ACCOUNT. I have uninstalled and re-installed the Kasa app numerous times, resetting the device every time. The same thing happens every single time. I am very good at computers (used to be a programmer) so this is not user error. I have tried to bypass the Kasa app by linking it to Tapo, but that app does not even recognize this device. I tried linking the 2 apps after installing the camera via Kasa, but STILL Tapo does not recognize this device. I cannot get support because I am living in Mexico. I have looked online and many people have this problem, but apparently Kasa does not care, and has not solved the problem. Yes it's cheap, but EVERY SINGLE CENT I spend on it was wasted. All I purchased was hours of hell trying and failing to get it to work.

reviewTitle: Disappointed. You will have to buy Care plan
reviewDescription: I normally don’t leave review but would love to see one like that before buying. I’ve been using it for about a month with Kasa Care 1 month free plan. It’s been great, but I also contacted customer service to make sure that once I cancel the Kasa Care I will still have camera access. They told me I need to buy micro sd to have 24/7 recordings when I cancel Kasa Care. Spent 25$ on this. After inserting the card I noticed that its still not saving clips of motion detection on the app. Contacted customer service again. They told me that Micro SD doesn’t allow you to see these clips, its only available with Kasa Care. So lets say you get a notification about motion detection, even if you go on the app a minute later, you won’t see what was happening – cause nothing was saving. Of course once you get home you can take the card, inserted in the computer and watch the whole day. Which is not only another hussle, but does not give you any security. I only bought the camera to see what’s happening when I’m not home. And you can’t do so unless you paying extra. The plan is additional 40$ per year (3$ per month + tax). Which makes the camera worth more than 80$ per year. Doesn’t worth it for sure.

This camera has no idea what it’s doing. I was so excited after reading the reviews. Knowing it can swivel completely around from any angle was a huge selling point for me.It has turned out to be a complete pain in the rear and I am sadly trashing it today after only about 6 weeks of use. The camera is sitting on my kitchen counter top, completely clear view on all sides except the wall behind it. And what does it do? Spins itself around every single night and stares at the wall, which misses everything happening in the kitchen and defeats the entire purpose of the camera. I have tried moving it to different spots. Attaching it to the wall seemed to work at first but then it started turning itself up to the damn ceiling. I give up. I have adjusted the motion detection, turned on only human motion, turned on and off Patrol Mode, adjusted the viewpoints, it doesn’t matter. It ALWAYS spins itself backwards. The worst part is, I have been paying for Kasa video recording and when I look at the recordings, it’s of my WALL. -.- I am so mad that I listened to the reviews, and disappointed that it didn’t solve my problem as I had hoped. (I have a son with autism and severe adhd who has no impulse control and must be monitored at night in this area for many reasons.)I wish I could have returned it before the return window closed but I missed it and now I’m out the money. :( Don’t do what I did.

The camera works fine but, I picked this model for the Starlight sensor. Unfortunately the overnight videos are all in b/w, they should be color. There doesn't appear to be a setting in the app that allows the Starlight to work.
Very average. Video feed is super laggy and slow. It allows me to see my pets from afar, but lots of bugs. You get what you pay for (cheap stuff). But ultimately works most of the time.

reviewTitle: Motion Detection Hit/Miss, Google Integration Meh, Picture quality great
reviewDescription: First the good, the picture quality on this camera is great. Even the night mode is clear as expected for a 2k camera. It really delivers. It's nice being able to control the viewing angle too to look around the room. I also like that the camera can be turned on and off for privacy and be scheduled (If only my life was entirely predictable and could be scheduled a little better).But now for the bad, the motion detection is really hit or miss on this. Especially at night, day time it's actually pretty good. I use this mostly as a cat camera and I was hoping to tell if anyone was breaking into my house. But sadly if you adjust the sensitivity too high it detects the cat as a person during the day and if you adjust it too low the camera fails to pick up the cat at night and will stay stuck in whatever orientation it was last in which may mean it's facing a corner where it last saw the cat sleeping during the day... Not great if you have windows on the other side of the house you were hoping it would notice motion on. To its credit you can have the camera rotate views at set times, but it specifically warns this will reduce its life span significantly and is not recommended.Also, how I was saying privacy mode is great since this is in the house and people may not want to be being recorded when we're home.... ya between all of our other smart apps it's a real pain this doesn't integrate better with google / alexa. I understand it's a "privacy" concern to be able to turn the camera on and off I guess but it's annoying that rather than just saying "hey google turn the camera off" I have to open the app half a dozen times a day to turn it off. Or I just can't make it a part of one of my routines. About all you can do is ask it to bring up the camera for viewing, which is great don't get me wrong... but not super useful since I likely have my phone on me and could just pull the app up rather than leaving my show.All and all a nice camera for the money. Still really useful to have, just wish for more convenience. Would be great at least if they would include pet detection like they have baby detection. If the thing moving isn't large enough to be a person I don't need an alert. You can set motion areas surely you can detect if an object is large enough to be a person, a dog, or a cat.

Frequently get an “operation failed” error. Connectivity issues are frustrating, with no solution other than removing the device from the app and restarting the connection process. Would not buy again.

It works OK, but very often does not recognize movement even on the highest sensivity or does not recognize humans or recognizes animals and pets as humans… App is OK, but not convenient. You can’t save/download the whole “event” video, you have to screen record it. Tried to download video files directly from SD card - non of my computers could recognize the SD card - gave somewhat kind of an error, even though it works fine in camera…
Tanta diversidad de aplicaciones, y esta cámara no se puede compartir con otro familiar, no me simpatiza para nada...
Followed the instructions but it’s too hard to set it up! Not my thing! Returned it!

It works and gives a good video but my problem with it is that I it randomly stops work when I go to check it on the app. Like there won't even be a camera on file and I didn't touch it, come home to find it still in place, light on but not register on the app anymore so that makes me nervous
It caught someone in my place who wasn't supposed to be there. Just no color
Yo nunca  la pude activar  y no la pude devolver

reviewTitle: Constant connectivity issues, would not work with Google Home
reviewDescription: Almost every other smart device in my house is Kasa (outlets, lights, etc.) and they work flawlessly, so when I needed a camera I figured I'd also get a Kasa camera since I had good luck previously with their other devices. Never again. I've never had so many issues with a camera before this one. It has constant connectivity issues; when I open the Kasa app and try to view the live stream of the video, it frequently will freeze and sit there loading forever; I usually have to force quit and relaunch the app for it to work, and even then it will eventually freeze. It also does not work with Google Home. All of my other Kasa devices show up and function in the Google Home app, however when I try to view this camera in the Google Home app, it just shows "Connecting..." and never connects. Wound up returning this and getting a Tapo camera instead (which, ironically is still made by TP-Link who also makes Kasa) and it works sooooo much better than this one without any connectivity issues whatsoever.

reviewTitle: Cameras are good, but the Kasa Care program is a fraud
reviewDescription: The Kasa cameras are great, but their Kasa Care service is a fraud. I particularly bought these cameras because of the good reviews and the Kasa Care service that I thought I was going to be able to purchase. What the help document in the android app tells you and what you actually get are completely different. Here is what I copied directly from their help document in the app:"General Questions about Kasa Care Here is what you might want to know about the new Kasa Care service.Q9: Can cancel or change my Kasa Care subscription?Yes. Your Kasa Care plan cancellation/ change will take effect immediately. The good- still image quality is very good. The app functions well and the way it saves the previous 3 days with the ability to save sections to your phone as u please are better than any camera used so far.The BAD died after 4 months which while better than the last 2 cameras, is compete garbage and i will not keep buying every few months. Bought this as a room monitor for my 2 going on 3 year old daughter’s room. Bought on march 7 / 23. Well it worked as it should was very helpful for me but as of a few weeks ago my daughter kept saying someone is watching me in the camera. Me thinking she’s just being dramatic because she knows we watch her on it didn’t think much of. It but she soon started asking her big brother ( age 5 ) to sleep in her room at night. Again we didn’t think much of it and said fine. Well yesterday morning 1/6/23 my daughter again came to me and said someone is watching me and my fiancé yelled at me and said stop play with the cam you’re freaking me out. I was in fact not playing with the cam and went to see what’s up well I walked in the room and stood in front of the cam as the red light was on indicating someone was watching my daughter then came back in the room and ran to her bed and the after a second of her sitting on it the cam tracked over to try and see her and when I stepped back in front it tried to turn the other way again. See error message from Google Home. reviewTitle: Weak/buggy software, you may lose access to the cam when you need it most
reviewDescription: Picture quality and motion detection and video recordings are fine. But you may lose all access to the cam due to some design flaw. That happened to me a few times when I was traveling abroad.Say, you are in a foreign country with no wifi and only with some slow cellphone coverage, and you try to access the cam with the Kasa app on your iPhone. The app gives a spin wheel then a couple of seconds later a popup notice saying "Operation failed", which is expected since your connection is slow. And if you try to access the cam again when your connection is still poor, you may suddenly notice that the cam is now marked as "Offline" in the Kasa app! And once it is marked as "Offline", you lose all access to the cam completely! This happened to me when I was traveling in Asia. And I waited for a couple of days and the cam was still "Offline". I had to ask someone to go to my place to power-cycle the cam to get it back online again! And this happened several times and at the end I gave up on remote access to the cam. During the same trip, I had no problem accessing my other wi-fi connected devices at home (Garage, thermostat, etc.)By the way, I've contacted Kasa's tech support but they refused to consider this is their design problem. Instead they insisted this is a problem with my home wifi.

reviewTitle: Great ....cheap camera ....just don't try to get any warranty.
reviewDescription: Got my order for 2 of these cameras.  Set-up was fast and easy.  They practically set themselves up.  I already had the KASA app on my phone for other items I have and they appeared no problem.  All was great.  Night vision is amazing and motion detection is spot-on.  Trouble?  Yes.  The first time I attempted to move one and plug the power cord into it again ...the receiver plug at the port fell loose into the camera.  Yep ...it's rattling around inside and the camera is useless.  Since I've had them for 6 months -I had to find out how to get it replaced under warranty.  After quite a bit of searching, I contacted them via email.  After reading other complaints here about poor service ...I wasn't expecting much.  AND ...I wasn't disappointed.  Their customer care service did exactly what I expected.  They required all of the information that you would expect ....PLUS pics of the invoice,  and another pic of the invoice, model #,  pic of the serial #. my phone #, my address, a replacement pic of the model # and so on.  Over a dozen email to get to the point where they MAY honor a warranty ...IF I register the product and go through what appears to be a smoke-screen of time-wasting jargon.  I replied to them that they won and I gave up and that I would reorder the camera with the understanding that the compnay warranty is a joke.  I tacked on a 3 year warranty through Amazon.  Great product when it doesn't break.  We'll see how it goes.

This was a great affordable camera for a short time.  I've owned for almost a year and a half and it's no longer functioning as it once did. Lots of issues . Which is to bad because we really enjoyed it. Time to upgrade . Wish it had lasted much longer than it did .

The cameras work pretty well. It's a big pain in the butt to get them reconfigured after they're disconnected for some reason, but the app is awful for me. The app also alerts you if the camera detects movement or “a person,” and I will say that I appreciate that it thinks my dog is a person XD On a serious note, I placed this camera near my front door and the notifications let me know when my dog is checking to see if I’m home yet.The the video and audio coming in from the device are also decent. Was so excited to get these & get them both set up. Everything was great until they stopped working. In less than 2 weeks one of the cameras works but won't pair at all, no matter what we do. reviewTitle: Unsecured,  spoke with Kasa customer service and they are taking care of it.
reviewDescription: My cameras were hacked,  the only reason I noticed was because I was watching it live, there was a strange man with a flashlight entering my room so In returned home immediately.  The footage was deleted.  I have 2 EC60 cams and thats where I saw the strange man.  The pan tilt camera was rotated all the way to the left facing the wall and I had no control over it before he entered. Very strange to say the least.  However I contacted Kasa and made them aware of the problem.  They took it seriously and gave me an updated app with 2 factor authentication.  I believe that its not available yet and is still in beta.  It solved my problem,  every now and then I would get a notification that someone was trying to gain access to my cams.  But didn't have the code.  Possibly the WiFi was hacked WPA3 can be downgraded to WPA2 so the attacker can use the same methods of capturing the handshake and decoding the password.  Caused a huge mess.  Constant deauths until I put 2&2 together.  I'm in the middle of moving and everything is a mess so who knows what was stolen.

reviewTitle: Basic camera that should support ONVIF & RTSP; Slightly Creepy
reviewDescription: I'll acknowledge that this is a pretty cheap camera and I should have reasonable expectations, I still find it inexcusable that TP-Link would choose to not provide ONVIF and RTSP support. I guess I can't ding the star rating for something it doesn't claim to do, but, they absolutely should.The app setup process requires location access. The app claims this is "to determine sunrise and sunset times." While it is nice that they actually offer an explanation, it's not a particularly believable explanation. At the very least, it doesn't belong in the first-time-camera-setup process. Prompt me for that later. Otherwise, it's just creepy.The app also doesn't do anything to automatically discover the camera. Further, it makes you switch wifi networks to continue the setup process. The IMOU Life camera setup process does that work for you. TP-Link should be able to do as much.Lastly, without internet access the camera is useless. Even though you're on the same wifi network with the camera, you can't use it if your internet goes down, which is just a poor engineering decision.To have any hope of achieving 5-stars, a camera absolutely needs RTSP support (preferably also ONVIF) so that I can use the camera with the Streamie app so that I can get it on my TV. If you're into vendor lock-in, this camera is a great choice.... :-/

They are such an affordable camera with a very comparable (if not better) picture than what we were using before. The app is very easy to use and we’ve never had an issue with them disconnecting. The issue we have with them however is the 2 red lights that glow on the camera when it is in “night vision mode” my 3 year old son is horrified of them and we have to keep them off. And our 6 month old just lays there and stares at the lights on hers so we often keep them off as well. And it doesn’t help that the camera is white circle with a black “face” and 2 red glowing eyes in the center. If you intend to use these as a baby monitor, I would reconsider.

reviewTitle: Decent camera but records even with recording setting off.
reviewDescription: I had ordered this as it is less expensive than the baby monitor that my wife wanted that was overpriced at $200+.Camera itself-It works great, just a slight delay on sound/movement.-Sound sensitivity is very good, it can hear me making noises downstairs with the doors open of course.-it makes a clicking noise when it turns on or night vision turns on. So if you don’t have it on 24/7 I suggest turning it on first before placing your baby as it may wake them.Camera settingsEasy to use settings, I bought it for monitoring and not recording. It does have an option for cloud storage or your own SD card.**Further info**Like I said I bought it not for recording, I had the settings off for recording BUT FAILED to notice a detail that it STILL RECORDS clips based on motion detected by x amount seconds and will start recording. I found out in the activity option that it had been recording us the whole time and RECORDING saved on KASAcloud, which I do not even subscribe to. I tried to download it but it said it was no longer available. But the clip image still visible and that I removed after.TO DISABLE it, do not enable motion sensor or person detection.Honestly felt robbed of my privacy as a recording of my newborn and us were recorded without our knowledge, when the whole time I thought having recording off would have been enough.Who knows who had access to it or if it is really deleted and not stored elsewhere.

reviewDescription: You got what you pay for with this one. It certainly works! I’m actually impressed with it ability to detect people, and see in the dark without night vision enabled. It’s like operating the Mars Rover between the delay and random glitches where it literally moves in the opposite direction you meant it to. Picture quality is moderate-to-poor, even at 1080p. It’s ability to locally record to an SD card (thus not needing a cloud service subscription) is a plus!

reviewTitle: 10/10 Value - Peace of Mind is Priceless
reviewDescription: My Beautiful Golden Retriever Girl is 6 months old and i’ve been using this camera since she was 2 months old! Being able to check on her whenever I want gives me such peace of mind if I’m not home, or shes in another room. I can’t even tell you how many socks, decor, shoes, cabinet corners i’ve saved from becoming this sneaky girls lunch from the other side of the house because of this camera.I went with this one because of the impressive amount of positive reviews while also being so affordable. Setup took all of 10 minutes and finding the perfect spot was easy because of how compact it is.A huge bonus is that a subscription is completely optional, unlike most others that require a fee or have very limited features without one. I can access the camera from anywhere and the app, i can see live video, it’s impressively clear quality whether day or night mode, sound detection notifications when a sounds made that’s louder than your set noise limit (in my case it’s to know when she’s barking), motion tracking is the most useful feature for us while we’re trialing her freedom moving into the teenage phase. Being able to be consistent whether home or not has made a drastic difference in how quickly she learns.10/10 Just buy it!

reviewDescription: I recently purchased this indoor surveillance camera, and it has been fantastic. The video quality is superb, with clear and crisp images that make it easy to monitor the interior of my home. The night vision capability is impressive, providing clear footage even in complete darkness. The two-way audio feature is a great addition, allowing me to listen and communicate through the camera. Setting up the camera was a breeze, and it integrates well with my smartphone app for real-time monitoring and alerts. It's been a month now and they seem to be working great. I get instant livestreaming wherever I'm at. With the great price and reliability, I'll be purchasing more of these now.

We didn't need to record any footage which would have taken a memory card but did take screen grabs now and then. I highly recommend this item for a pet nanny cam. It automatically moves up, down, side to side, by motion section, or you can move it by the app on your phone.Easy set up, works off your home wifi, and plugs into an electrical outlet, no batteries required. Picture quality is awesome, you can take still photos as well. I do not have a subscription, currently we are using it to keep an eye on our 2 ducks, as we are transitioning them into a new living space, I work from home on the 2nd floor, so I can just check on them with my phone. Oh..and it had a microphone too. Highly recommend, especially for the price, if your looking for a little added security or for a babies room, pets etc. You won't be disappointed. My camera is placed on the window sill INSIDE our house, the window is dirty from the ducks, but you can see the great pics it takes.

Super easy to set up and use camera that allows you to watch over a large space, I use it to keep an eye on my two 1 year old kitties and I couldn’t be happier knowing even though i’m an hour away from home that they aren’t causing any problems.Only downside I have to say about the camera is sometimes it can feel a bit clunky and unresponsive when you’re trying to turn the camera in the app to the right angle to be able to see the most coverage of my apartment.

I bought this to keep an eye on my dog while at work as he roams the house. Likes: the camera is really good when its not panning. Its easy to set up the app, just follow the instructions it tells you. It pans well and sets up zones. You click the zone you want and it automatically goes to the set point. The activity alerts pop up all the time which is annoying but also nice at the same time so i know when he starts to move around.  Also when you are on the app away from home, the microphone (from camera) picks up sound perfectly. I can hear when he barks or even what tv show is on for him. The “night vision” is really clear so you can see decently good when its pitch black. Now the Dislikes:  first i have to say is the microphone (from the app) or speaker,  to me it doesnt pick up your voice till late over the camera speaker and end up only hearing parts out of the camera speaker. Its also muffled sounding even when talking slow to try to get it to pick up what youre saying.  It would be nice to be able to talk to him when he gets restless.  Next the panning function from the app. When you move the camera its lags. Meaning when you move the camera, you have to let go of the “joystick” early in order for it to stop where you want it. Also when you, lets say, pan left, right at the start it will move a different direction and than pan left. Its weird. The camera itself also goes blurry when panning but once you stop its clear as can be.  Overall its a decent camera for $30.

reviewTitle: Does NOT work with Google Home
reviewDescription: Received camera today, 03 14 24.  It was listed as being able to work on Google Home & Alexa.  I have Google Home for my old Nest Dropcam which is being removed 04 08 24, so I purchased this camera to replace it because it said it works with Google Home.  Luckily the Kasa mobil app for android allows me to download it to various devices I use in different rooms of my home.  I used the old Nest camera as my doorbell camera & this one will take its place.  I need viewing devices in several rooms so I can see whoever comes to my driveway & front door.  Camera is not the issue, the view is excellent.  My beef is that false info was included in the presentation.  I don't use Alexa because it requires Blue tooth connection.

reviewTitle: Fantastic Dog cam. Not so fantastic security camera
reviewDescription: Pros:-Great price for what you get.-Fantastic video quality (the picture is with low quality video enabled).Cons:- Slow across the board. Kasa blames internet connection and that is and is not the case. With the price point and how it works. Even the fastest internet will struggle. Further more the input lag makes it almost impossible to use the camera rotation well. SD playback is slow as well. The reality is if you are only using the SD card; their are a lot of internet based steps to get to your phone.-The camera detects people when they are not there. Tried to find many solutions but it's just not there.Even with all that said I'm tempted to give it a 5 star BUT their is one super con that is a deal breaker.Super con:-there is no gaurd mode.Sounds stupid but it really needs it. There is an overall lack of some major features even with the paid subscription. This one is the biggest. There is no way to utilize the cameras detection abilities.There are only two options: always detect, or set a schedule.Sounds fine but it's aweful.If you plan on leaving the house and want to get notified about detection. To bad you can't because you set a schedule for when you are at work. You think... Well I'll just turn it always on when I leave. When you do that it clears the schedule that you made. Still doesn't sound too bad? Well you have to do that for every camera you own and it takes time. You need to wait for the icon to load for the one camera... Tap on that to view the picture then you can access the camera, change your settings then go back and do it for the next camera. So on and so fourth. Then later you need to input the schedule for each individual camera all over again.I love kasa products and this camera is great. It just needs a bit more.3 out of 5 for security camera.5 out of 5 if you just use it to manually check in on family or pets.
Picture quality was good. Easy setup. Audio was not that good.

I got this to watch my dog and cats when I'm away. I wanted to get a view of the hallway and my dining room so I had to mount it on the wall near the ceiling.In order to get it to view down the hall I had to put washers behind the lower screw so the mount was tilted toward the ceiling more. I tried to make sure I got the mount centered right but the template only tells you how far apart the screws are not where the camera rests. I was off by about a half inch which makes the camera tilted to the right when at rest making it not centered on the room I want to detect motion from. It will sometime stay center after I adjust it on the app but not always so I end up with a rotated view of half the room and it doesn't pickup motion from the other half of the room.The motion sensor doesn't always detect my pets so its unreliable for tracking.The zones I set to detect motion in dont work.  Only 2 of the zones show the right area the other 2 show the ceiling even though I've tried resetting them several times.When I pan the camera from my phone it tells me I've reached the limit even though I know it can show the entire room. I then have to move it to the other side and up or down to get it to move to back to the side I wanted to view.Luckily I haven't had any connection issues and the recording 24/7 works fine.  Maybe it would work better if I had it on a shelf rather than wall mount. Overall I'm not impressed and wouldn't buy it again.
i’m not really a fan of these. i use them to watch my cats and they never work. i’ve had them for months. i try to use my phone to turn them but it doesn’t work and disconnects. wouldn’t recommend
No entendí cómo instalar

I bought severas of these.They work great and have great settings.They have been a great help keeping an eye on the baby.The only problem I had with them is they keep destroying my sd cards. To the point that they become unsuable. I have bought severas sds, new from different places and I have gone trough 5 sds and it say the sd is not original. Same issue 5 times. Overall the camera works well and gives a quality image to check on my dog throughout the day while I’m at work. However the camera often has issues connecting to the network despite every other device I own having no problems. It often disconnects 2-3 days out of the week at random and reconnects at will. It is a nice camera with very sharp image - not very easy to use at first - however be aware that to fully use the activities and recording you do need to enroll in a monthly service. It is not expensive but I really wanted to avoid that. I got tricked once more. Nothing says that in the description. I will try for 30 days and see if I find it useful for pets.

reviewTitle: Need Wifi - not what I expected
reviewDescription: Based on the written description at the time of my purchase and reviews, I was under the impression I could use this as a plug in camera, put an SD card in it and keep it completely offline. Nope, I needed to connect it to wifi to set it up. The whole point was I didn't want it ever connected so that videos of my home were not hackable. Now, even if I disconnect it I know devices remember old connections. The two stars are simply because if you don't mind the wifi being necessary, it seems a quality camera and pictures for the price.

They have way more good reviews than they have bad so I’m very disappointed once I connected to the Internet it just stops blinking orange and green and just go to blinking orange. I reset it like five times at this point I think I’m going to just burn it out, idk if I need to send it back or if there is another solution

reviewTitle: Not a useful baby monitor camera
reviewDescription: They advertise this as a baby monitor, but noises such as a door closing, dog barking once in another room or even talking will register as crying and send an alert. The camera footage can also freeze randomly for long periods of time while still displaying the "live" wording across the top, only realizing it's frozen when you hear crying. On top of that, they intentionally sell a more expensive clone of this camera with different firmware that supports RTSP so you'd be able to use other software to view the camera or integrate it into a DVR but they handicap this version to stop you doing that. You're stuck with the Kasa app, and unfortunately it sucks for cameras. Unfortunate because I have a bunch of their light switches and switched outlets, was hoping to keep that ecosystem going.There are positives. The picture quality in low light is very good, the night vision, at least indoors at short range is very good, and the pan/tilt works pretty well. Motion detection and following works well too. They got the hard stuff right, and screwed the pooch on the basics.Connected via a Unifi AP-AC-LITE with excellent signal strength. Problems exist with locally connected clients on a network with no local WiFi interference (middle of a wheat field.)

reviewTitle: Good Kasa camera with one tine issue-does not link to Google Home
reviewDescription: I bought this camera based on good prior experiences with numerous Kasa switches and the statement on Amazon that it works with Google Home.  It does not.All apps up to date, latest iOS and all my other Kasa devices are linked to Google Home.It’s a disappointment and will likely be returned for another manufacturer’s camera.

I posted this inside the window seal during a rainy day which was the next day after I received it. During the day it seemed ok for the most part. Once night hit, it was a big NO GO. Even with adjusting the setting still a NO GO. I needed to see a specific area at night and it didnt help.I placed it in the window inside of my place because it said its not for outside. I wanted to try this brand out doors but im thinking WYZE will be better for what I need.Good in the daytime with rain but at not with rain you cant see a thing.

I use this to keep an eye on my cat during long days in the office. It worked great for about two months and then stopped connecting to my wifi. I’ve tried several times to reset it. Wish I’d gone with a different product. It was great peace of mind when it worked.

reviewTitle: No Cloud Storage in Other countries.
reviewDescription: An intruder entered my house, stole my memory and I was left with no clue who it was. It does not record in the cloud. It is useless as a security system.

We purchased this camera to leave in the living room of my mother-in-law's house where she spends most of her time. Hooking it up with easy, recognizing the Verizon Wi-Fi. Were used a different camera system that only recognized 2G so that this picked up 5G was extremely helpful. The camera was clear and easy to navigate with an app. About a month then, the camera no longer recognized any Wi-Fi signal to connect to. Troubleshooting was unsuccessful. Now the window to return the product has closed.

We bought this camera to monitor our puppy while we are at work. It’s spotty at best. Very disappointing. It hasn’t worked for a full week. Unfortunately we missed the window of time to return it. We will spend the extra money and get a ring camera or something reliable.

I am fairly tech savvy, but this was just poor. In a world of “plug n play” the app and set up was unacceptable. Less features and more ease of use is what I’d like. The app was pretty buggy even after a few updates. Did I get an older version??Set up seemed good until it went offline after a few minutes. Not much help in the set up instructions to get back online. The wifi on the unit seemed to just quit. After numerous tries, restarts, entering my wifi password and several verification codes sent by the app (twice it wouldn’t allow me to enter the code), I attempted to reset the unit as instructed. The reset button seemed to do nothing. Blinked that it was online but I couldn’t add the device.I gave this a good hour, and again, I’m pretty tech savvy, but when the online manual and support offered little help…back in the box and returned.Seemed like a nice device, maybe I got a dud.

Before I purchased this camera, I read a ton of reviews. Many were positive, but several mentioned that the camera worked perfectly at first and then suddenly stopped working. I should have listened.The Kasa Cam Spot/Tilt worked so well at first. It was easy to configure and gave me peace of mind while traveling or just being away from home. Then a little over a month after first use, it quit. I fought with it and reset everything several times over and got it working again. Then the return window closed and within days, it quit working for good. I have tried everything suggested on the app and the troubleshooting website, but absolutely nothing will convince this device to finish setup and work once again.I own and use other Kasa smart devices and I was hopeful that this would be an excellent addition to my home. I'm very disappointed with this purchase, and it was a definite waste of money. I guess you really do get what you pay for, and this camera was surprisingly inexpensive. Bought in July of 2023. Was working wonderful. Now, all of a sudden, my live feed is lagging. I cant pull up recorded videos. Seriously was working perfect, now, not so much. I debated on writing anything, but i am so irritated and frustrated at what used to be a quality product. Maybe only good for a few months. That's what it feels like.

reviewTitle: Not working well after one month
reviewDescription: Originally this camera worked great. I use it to check in on my pets while I am gone. After about a month and half it has stopping working so well. The app often crashes, the video stream freezes. I cannot control the camera direction from the app anymore.
I had the worse time trying to get the camera connected to the wifi and you have to have an SD card to be able to record.

The image quality on this camera is great, however, the panning feature seizes up regularly and the camera will not do a full 360° rotation. It often stops quite short of the target location. It is very frustrating and it’s happened on both of the cameras that I purchased independently. Warranty is only two years, and seems that this stops working right around that mark. So for a two-year lifespan, you’re better off going with a Wyze camera.

reviewTitle: Will not work with an open Wi-Fi network
reviewDescription: Firstly, I have 3 other Kasa cameras, several bulbs, and MANY outlet plugs. I’m am very familiar with TP-Link’s products and their app and set-ups.I bought this camera specifically to keep an eye on our pet in the RV at Disney World. I tested it at home, attached it to my travel router, and every thing worked just fine.  However, when we got to the campground, it did not want to connect to my travel router. After many many attempts, I just decided to risk it and connect it to the public Disney campground Wi-Fi while we were gone from the camper.  When I tried to do that, it coughed up a message to the effect that Kasa has decided not to allow access to public Wi-Fi. NOWHERE in any of the information about the camera does it mention this vital fact. That is their choice, but I would have appreciated knowing that in advance. Obviously, I would never have bought it if I had known that. And by the time we took the trip, the return window had closed.

reviewTitle: Great capabilities for the price until it stopped working
reviewDescription: After maybe 2 months I wasn’t able to connect to the camera 90% of the time when I was out of my home.EDIT I wrote the following before having: connections issuesI’d have given this 5 stars if it hadn’t been such a pain in the butt to set up- I got stuck when connecting the camera to Wi-Fi and it took a couple hours, several times and a few google searches to figure it out, even though I’m pretty ok with technology.Yes, it’s buggy - the camera says it can’t rotate anymore when I know it can, it goes left sometimes when I want it to point up, there’s a lag. But is has like 70% of the features of similarly products that are 3-5x its price. I can point the camera, I can usually talk through it, and I can stream it from my phone, that’s pretty good for me!Overall I’d recommend it to others.

reviewTitle: Important things to know about this product
reviewDescription: First off, I am a cybersecurity expert and admittedly hypersensitive to my privacy. That being said, I am no longer using this product due to the TPLink/Kasa cloud service requirement. This product can not be used strictly on a local network and you cannot directly control the camera from a client device (phone/tablet/PC/etc.). It MUST go through TPLink/Kasa’s cloud services to function. This doesn’t sit well with me, but I understand a lot of people will have no problem with this.Privacy concerns aside, this camera had network connection issues where the camera would drop off the network very frequently to the point that it became unusable. I had the camera <10 feet from my 2.4Ghz wireless access point. No other devices had the same connections issues, so it was not an issue with my network. The ability to store footage locally via SD card was a nice fallback to these issues, however SD storage comes pretty standard on similar cameras from competitors as well.This is a great, cheap camera for a lot of people. It just wasn’t for me. Had I not thrown out the packaging, I would’ve returned it.
The camera won’t connect to my wifi no matter what, wish I could return but the window has closed for that.

reviewTitle: Almost a Perfect $36 Dollars Camera, But a Software Update Needed
reviewDescription: When panning the camera left to right or right to left from different viewpoints, there is an error kept popping up. Software update needed to solve this problem. So far, this $36 dollars camera does what it supposed to; however, it is not panning 360 degree as advertised, it’s missing a corner to complete a 360 degree rotation. reviewTitle: Que no la compren no dura mucho se daño sola.
reviewDescription: A lo primero grabó excelente, buen video y luego de 8 meses de usó se apagó y no prendió más dejo de funcionar no la recomiendo.

Things I like, loads video to SD card, can pan and tilt, not dependent on a service plan.Things I’m not so happy about, slower response in retrieving videos, the 2K QHD video quality is not as good as the Ring indoor cam (which is pretty poor), the associated app is clunky, you can’t erase individual video or photos.I got this so if Ring goes down, which it has in the past, I still have a camera running. License plates are just as unreadable as the 1080p Ring camera. What is it with cameras not being able to read a license plate? This needs to be changed. Overall it’s just mediocre. Yes it’s a camera but it is slow to respond and not great video. I’m glad I have this one but won’t buy another of these. I’ll keep looking for something that doesn’t cost thousands to set up but can give a reading on a license plate. People who are stealing these days don’t care if you see their face so it would be nice to track them down through their vehicle.
The description says it includes a 64 GB micro card. It does not. You need to buy a micro card separately.

After about 2 months, the panning stopped working correctly. It would get stuck and so when I tried to pan around the room from work on the app, the camera said I reached the end, the camera was still pointing at the floor. I had to manually readjust and make sure not to use the panning as to not lose view of the puppies (which is why I got the camera).

reviewTitle: Hard to set up. Wants temp wifi
reviewDescription: Downloaded the app. Went through the steps. Wanted to set up temp wifi. Said it was connected. And did nothing. No real instructions. Contacted Xfinity and they couldn't get it connected either. Ended up spending the same amount on a fixed cam for my puppy. Only need it to keep an eye while in crate. Same amount of money and connected instantly with the rest of my Ring products.

reviewTitle: My own 2 ears are more reliable
reviewDescription: Only purchased because my Safety 1st camera wouldn’t connect when we moved into a new space. Man how I miss Safety 1st. This camera is NO help. It’s the exact same as when I had no camera at all. One little notification is not going to wake me up. I turned the Sensitivity up. Still nothing. I have no idea how long my baby has been crying or that she started moving around.Every time I turned the Baby Crying sensitivity all the way up it automatically turns it back down to zero.Not sure what’s up with that, I submitted a complaint on that one.The camera itself is great quality but what’s the use if it never notifies me and I have to rely on my own sense to realize the baby is up??I recommend the Safety 1st camera, it will not stop notifying you of every significant sound and motion until you turn it off!So frustrating because the first camera was a gift and I don’t have 100+ bucks to spend on another camera that will actually do its job.

reviewTitle: Not of Value unless you subscribe to the paid Cloud subscription plans
reviewDescription: Not Happy with this Camera :-( - New Version w/SD SlotPros:- Sleek Design- OK Day time picture quality (at times, day time picture too appears in night vision mode if light is low!)- 24x7 live view is OKCons:- Not of much use without their Cloud subscription plan for storage- SD card video cannot be accessed via the App- Activity video recording does not get stored to SD card- 24x7 recording required to capture activities- Very tedious to go through the video clips as each clip is about 5 to 15 mins in duration (do the match on the # of clips for 24 hrs)- If Activity Zone are set and camera is facing say Zone 1 and there is motion in the opposite side, say Zone 4, then the camera does not rotate and capture the motion- Camera Pan/Tilt is noisy and the video captures this noise too!I bought this camera to monitor my Kitten's night time activities. Since the camera came with SD card storage, I thought I can check the videos from the SD card via the App and can skip purchasing any Cloud subscription plan! But that is not the case...to watch the video stored in the SD card you need to put the SD card on your laptop SD card slot (assuming it has a SD card slot or you have to use a SD card adaptor) to view the videos. Imagine you going through the whole night's recording which are in 5 to 15 mins clips to find out the movements / activities???! You will be spending hours doing it..totally useless, unless you want to use it just for live view or to get motion alerts and then check the live view or buy their cloud subscription plan.The worse thing is that videos are recorded to SD card only if you enable 24x7 recording. So only if motion alerts are enabled no videos are recorded. In the app if you check the activity, it says no activities recorded in the cloud! So they want you to buy the subscription plans to view motion alert related videos. I would have bought a Blink or some similar camera, but fell for this as it had pan/tilt option, which now I feel I can live without that feature.

The camera plug port is rattling inside the camera base so it can’t be plugged in. It seems the bottom is difficult to get off so trying to replace the port is a lost cause. I am hoping I can return this without and hassles and get a new one.

reviewTitle: "This device is not currently supported" ≠ "Fully compatible with Amazon Alexa"
reviewDescription: Camera a is pretty easy to set up in the KASA app, but while it can be added to the smarthome section of Alexa as a device, it can't be integrated with any routines. So, for example, I can't tell automate my Echo Dot to turn on the camera when it detects beeping overnight. I wish I had set it up sooner as I probably would have returned for a different camera.  Product really should not be advertised as "Works w/ Alexa & Google Home】Fully compatible with Amazon Alexa" since the extent of its integration with a screenless device is manual enable/disable, person detection, and motion announcements. Good thing it works with the larger memory card I bought as i will probably leave it running 24/7 since the routines/schedules I had anticipated setting up are inoperative or insufficient. It does work with a 256 gb  MicroSDXC (mine is SAMSUNG PRO Plus microSD Memory Card + Reader), and even formats the card for you, but I am very disappointed I can't loop the camera into any routines.Also, while you can pan/tilt, zoom, etc., you cannot tell the camera to remain pan/tilted and zoomed to a particular zone unless it is acting on motion detection, which of course cannot differentiate between significant/unusual motion and banal ones (I don't need it to track the back of my head; I need it to capture incoming faces), and thus renders it a pretty useless feature imo.
Not wireless and Not well built after I received this very flimsy piece of junk I realized.....u get what you pay for. It's too cheaply made.

reviewTitle: Cute camera for your house, but not what I bought it for
reviewDescription: It's a cute camera for the house and works pretty well for the price point. However I bought it for traveling with my dogs so I could keep an eye on them if I have to leave them alone in a strange place. The camera will not connect to hotel networks as they are unsecured. The description does not mention this, so the camera is basically useless to me. Well, I guess I learned something from the purchase.

Would not buy again
Hoy recibí el pedido muy entusiasmado, y cuando lo intenté usar no encontraba mi red wifi. Probé varios modos y no encuentra mi red wifi.

reviewTitle: can not record only motion on sd card
reviewDescription: you can either record 24/7-- all the time or pay to record motion only.other brand can just record montion on sd card which is very useful.unless kasa update software before the return window, I will return it.

reviewTitle: Good quality of recording, poor configuration options
reviewDescription: I want to record small clip to SD camera once my camera detects motion. That's the only feature I'm interested in and no other options can possibly be of use for my scenario.I'm glad the camera allows to turn off the Audio and dial down to 0 the microphone. The configuration beyond this was a nightmare...At first I even thought that the camera was not capable of recoding upon motion at all and left 1 star rating. Some hours of investigation later I figured the camera can record to SD card, but not upon motion, only non stop (every clip is 1 minute long). This is such a waste of SD space and my time, as I have to dumpster dive for the files with motion and then move them elsewhere.Completely unintuitively, there happens to be a small button in the app to watch the videos from SD card. It took me days to find it... Anyway, that's not helpful at all for my purpose either. I still have to take SD card from the camera every coupe of days, manually hunt for the clips that have motion, move them to other location and clean the card.I believe the creators of this product were cloud (and extra subscription) oriented people. I understand the need to monetize, I do get it. But... the application (and the camera) could be sooooo much more useful if it had user friendly interface and considered people who do not want store their content in the cloud for some reason.

reviewTitle: Only works best with a subscription
reviewDescription: I had one of these for years and it eventually stopped working but I used to keep it on a windowsill in direct sun so I wasn't surprised. This new one I got is substantially the same as the old one however Kasa removed the free cloud recordings. If you want any cloud recording at all you have to pay for it now.I had an SD card lying around so i put that in and it works OK. It's odd that the only way to use the SD card is to turn on 24 hour a day recording. Why can't it just record activity? Also, you can't see the activity from the activity page, you have to go onto the camera and look for the 24 hour recording button and then find the recording there, it's a pain.I know Kasa wants to make extra money on the subscriptions but they could give some free tier like 10 second recordings saved for 24 hours in the cloud.
worked great but the cord is so thin it broke and the device no longer works.

reviewTitle: Nice video, but only works 25% of the time...
reviewDescription: When my neighbor started bringing home warranted felons (for real, the sheriffs kept dragging her new toys away), I decided to get cameras for my home. I purchased 4. The price is good, and the images are great. They have good night vision and the app is nice. I can move them remotely and even yell at people from miles away. Super useful... IF the cameras connect to the app. I have tried uninstalling each camera, uninstalling the application, checking for updates,  switching my IP like the app suggests, and still, I get to use my cameras about 25% of the time I log in to check them. Also, if you have them installed inside windows like I do (neighborhood doesn't allow them on the outside), any small amount of light or your curtains behind them will cause reflections.
