reviewTitle: Poor Choice For Standalone Use With a mini-SD Card
reviewDescription: I purchased model KC410S 0n 12/22/2021. It is running the latest firmware, version 2.3.6. I am using Kasa app version 2.35.2, build 1028. My first impressions are that I like the hardware but hate the software/firmware file saving features available without an internet connection.I have an application that does not have real time access to the internet. I’d like to leave the KC410S unattended to record events and then manually check it periodically. By only recording events, I would expect my 64g miniature sd card to fill slowly and to only contain data that I want to look at.Unfortunately, the only way to have files written to the sd card is to enable the 24/7 mode. This mode saves 1 minute videos continuously: 1 folder per day containing 24 sub-folders, 1 for each hour in a day. Each sub-folder contain 60 files, one for each minute in that hour. THERE IS NO WAY TO JUST SAVE EVENT VIDEOS TO THE SD CARD! I do get a folder for each hour an event occurred that contains 1 jpg image, 640 x 360, for each event in that hour. What a mass of mainly useless data to wade through to try and find video that matches the event! If I want to have easy access to event data, I must have internet access and purchase a paid subscription plan. (During setup I was offered 2 choices, 1) $3/month per camera plan or 2) a $10 plan for up to 10 cameras. )If you plan on using the cloud service, you may be very happy with this camera but for my application, it is a fail. I‘ll update this review if future software updates fix this deficiency for standalone users.

reviewTitle: Cheap Price = Cheap Quality NOT RECOMMENDED
reviewDescription: We have 2 previous model Kasa Cameras Model # KC110 & KC115. We use these with Kasa Care Cloud Subscription & MicroSD. They have operated excellent with very little issues on rare occasions. These 5 newer model KC410S cameras are plagued with numerous issues. Note: All of these cameras are on same TP-LINK (Kasa) Mesh Network with average speeds of 450MBPS. The KC410S cameras have VERY Serious lagging delays when trying to view LIVE and sometimes takes minutes for cameras to show Live View if at all. The settings for Motion Detection Sensitivity and Time are set to the most Sensitive / Shortest settings. Yet these cameras won't detect Motion over 50% of the time and when they do will only record for a few seconds even though Motion is actively ongoing. Trying to access files on cloud service only shows very little of actual activities and many clips are unavailable with square X indicating Errors. The recordings on MicroSD are intermittent with breaks of nothing recorded even though settings are for Recording 24/7 . I am under the impression it is issues with the Software & Chip rather than the build quality of the video cameras because the picture quality is excellent and the pan & tilt features work flawlessly when you are able to access the cameras Live. We have other brand cameras in same price range that don't have any of the issues of delays showing Live View or Detecting and Recording Motion.  Until Kasa Resolves the 2 Crippling Issues with its App as of March 2022, I STRONGLY DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.

WARNING: The product description for the KC410S pan/tilt camera is MISLEADING. The description says: “continuously records and stores footage OR video clips on a local MicroSD card…” Tech support confirms my experience that there is no way to store just motion video clips on the SD card. Instead, you must set the camera to record continuously (24/7) to be able to later review those portions of the footage where motion was detected. Since recording continuously can fill up your SD card quickly, check the Kasa knowledge base to get estimates of the size SD card you will need for your purposes.  (You are able to schedule continuous recording for just portions of the day.) Note also that the SD card video is not encrypted. If a thief steals your camera or SD card they can view your recordings on a computer. An alternative is to pay monthly for Kasa’s cloud storage. SECOND WARNING: If you want to use multiple activity zones, you must set the camera in “Patrol Mode.” This means the camera motor is constantly engaged as the camera moves to each zone for a user-selected time period. Kasa’s knowledge base warns that Patrol Mode may prematurely damage the motor (although for 2-years the warranty should cover such damage.) These are disappointments to me along with sometimes-slow response. But with those exceptions I like Kasa’s pan/tilt camera. Having both Arlo and Eufy cameras, Kasa offers some settings that I like. reviewTitle: Basic Camera with a lot of nice options!
reviewDescription: I am writing this review for the Kasa smart indoor camera EC70, features may change from past to future models. I do have a separate security system for the outdoors, and I wanted something simple and portable to use indoors. I chose the Kasa camera because I already have the Kasa smart plugs. For about $20 dollars this is a camera with a lot of nice features. It is extremely easy to install and use. First, download the Kasa Smart App and create an account. Second, plug the camera into a power source, open the app add the camera and follow the directions. Once added, use the 3rd party tab to add to your Alexa account and google home account. If you already have added those accounts, then the camera will automatically be added and you can access it through the Alexa and google home app. The camera once added did require a firmware update and this took about 2 minutes. Some helpful tips I learned during my encounter with set up. The EC70 camera will accept a microSD card from 8 to 256GB used for local storage. Even though it tells you during set up to add, you will NOT be able to do so unless the camera is tilted up as high as it can go. So, you may have to finish set up, then start the camera and tilt it up before you can install it. For the Alexa app, the app will NOT turn the EC70 camera on or off. I am able to connect the camera to my Echo Show and FireTV only. The camera WILL send notifications to any Amazon device, and you are able to pick which devices to receive notifications. For google home, it is essentially the same, you need to have a Nest or Chromecast device in order to view the EC70 camera output. You probably will need to use the google help page for instructions on how to set it up. You can set the EC70 camera for different views of the area you wish to see, and can also place it on patrol mode to automatically move to each view. There are a wide range of positions available to meet your particular specifications and needs. The camera is mobile, unless you attach it to a wall or ceiling with the included bracket. The picture quality is great, and you do have options for the video quality settings depending on your wifi. I read other reviews and some of the negativity of the EC70 camera most likely is due to your wifi, not the actual equipment. I have used this camera to watch the front door when I am in the back, and also to watch the dogs. It is nice to receive the notification that they are at the door, so I can let them out to do their business. I am very happy with my purchase. I hope you find this review helpful.

reviewTitle: Not for safety or security monitoring
reviewDescription: Motion detection notifications are very unreliable, and the app sometimes  cannot connect to the camera.POOR MOTION DETECTION NOTIFICATIONS - I installed this camera to help with elder care in the home. Again, I have had multiple email conversations with different departments at the tp-link customer support and no one has been able to solve this either.POOR TWO-WAY AUDIO - the audio that comes from the camera to the app is good. However, the speaker in the camera is so tiny and weak that no one in the room being monitored can hear communications or even notice when someone is speaking to them through the camera.POSITIVES - The pan and tilt function works very well. Picture quality is good and night vision is effective. Setting up through the app is very easy, although continued functionality is incredibly spotty.SUMMARY - this would probably be a great camera for someone at work who wants to see what their cat is doing during the day. Don't use it in any case where reliable video or audio is necessary! If you want it just for entertainment or casual viewing, it will be perfect.

reviewDescription: I'm not a fan of the limited options for recording. I have a Blink camera that records motion, and this wants to record 24/7 or not at all. I'm not a fan for limited settings.

reviewTitle: Sub-par speaker quality, no sharing for the devices in the app!!
reviewDescription: Pros:1- It has a usable motion tracking function2- It provide on smart-phone notifications about motion, audio and baby crying..Cons:Bought KASA EC70 to replace Xiaomi Mi 360 Home camera, as the latter does not have an option to notify about audio detection, motion detection or baby crying (to be fair the latter exists as an option under AI settings in the app, but never works practically). However, I was surprised to discover:1- that no family sharing of home smart home devices exist. You family members must have the same account logged-in on their phones.2- the audio from the speakers is very lound when it rings when you press on the microphone button, but muffled when transfering the audio as you speak.3- there is a lag in transferring the video from the camera to the phone.4- Xiami Mi360 Home Camera's picture quality is a little better..Overall:The product is fair, and in terms of quality better than most generic chinese products, especially in terms of privacy (if you are concerned about it). reviewDescription: I bought two of these to watch our cats since they were having some issues and needed a 24/7 recording option to watch their activity…. and for a while they worked great. However, the 24/7 functionality on one of the cameras has completely stopped working, doesn’t matter if I factory reset the camera or try different SD cards, it refuses to read the SD card. It’s only been 6 months so pretty poor longevity there. I tried to get a replacement through Amazon who told me to go to the manufacturer, but their warranty process is very onerous for a $34 camera, so I’ll just buy a camera from a different brand in the future. I would also say while the app looks like the 24/7 recording function needs work… it does take a long time to load recordings and also it only lets you review in 5 min increments, so if you want to view 1:03 PM you have to watch from 1:00 PM for 3 minutes and be glued to it so you don’t miss what you’re looking for, which can be tedious. reviewTitle: Reliable and versatile indoor security solution
reviewDescription: The Kasa Smart 2023 New Indoor Pan-Tilt Security Camera (EC71) is a versatile and feature-rich security solution for monitoring your home, pets, and babies. With its 1080p HD video quality, night vision, motion detection, and compatibility with Alexa and Google Home, it offers a comprehensive security package. Its ability to pan and tilt provides extensive coverage, and options for both local and cloud storage add to its flexibility.Key Features:1. 360° Pan/Tilt Field of View:  - The camera's 360° horizontal and 113° vertical range allows you to monitor an entire room or walkway. The Patrol Mode feature lets you set intervals to monitor different regions automatically.2. Motion Tracking:  - The camera can automatically track moving objects or people, providing real-time alerts to enhance your security system's effectiveness.3. Detection & Instant Notification:  - Get push notifications when motion or a person is detected. You can also enable baby crying detection, making it suitable as a baby monitor. Notifications help you discern important events from everyday activities.4. 2-Way Audio with Built-In Siren:  - The 2-way audio feature allows you to communicate with pets or family members remotely. The built-in siren can deter intruders, enhancing home security.5. Secure Local or Cloud Storage:  - Save footage on a microSD card (up to 256 GB, not included) or subscribe to Kasa Care for cloud storage with a 30-day video history and additional features like Video Summary and Activity Notifications with Snapshots.6. Night Vision up to 30 Ft.:  - The integrated IR system provides clear night vision up to 30 feet, ensuring you don’t miss any activity in low-light conditions.7. 1080P Full HD Video:  - Capture detailed 1080p Full HD video, making it easy to see small details like what your baby is holding or what your pet is playing with.8. Works with Alexa & Google Home:  - Compatible with Amazon Alexa and Google Home, you can use voice commands to view live streams on devices like Echo Show or Google Chromecast.Pros:- Extensive Coverage: The 360° pan and 113° tilt provide comprehensive room coverage.- Versatile Monitoring: Suitable for home security, pet monitoring, and baby monitoring.- Real-Time Alerts: Instant notifications for motion, people, and baby crying.- 2-Way Communication: Interact with pets or family members remotely.- Multiple Storage Options: Choose between local microSD storage and cloud storage with Kasa Care.- Clear Night Vision: Up to 30 feet of night vision ensures you don’t miss activity in the dark.- High-Definition Video: 1080p HD video for clear and detailed footage.- Smart Home Integration: Works seamlessly with Alexa and Google Home.Cons:- Occasional Slow Response: Some users report that the camera can be slow to respond at times.- SD Card Not Included: The microSD card for local storage is not included, which requires an additional purchase.- Subscription Cost: Accessing full cloud storage features requires a subscription to Kasa Care.Conclusion:The Kasa Smart 2023 New Indoor Pan-Tilt Security Camera (EC71) is a highly functional and flexible security solution for any home. Its wide range of features, including motion tracking, 2-way audio, night vision, and compatibility with smart home devices, make it a standout choice. While there may be occasional slow response times, the overall performance and ease of use make it a worthwhile investment for enhancing your home security.Recommendation:I highly recommend this camera to anyone in need of a reliable and versatile indoor security solution. Its extensive features, coupled with high-definition video quality and smart home integration, provide excellent value for the price. Whether you're monitoring pets, babies, or general home security, this camera is a robust and user-friendly choice.

reviewTitle: Easy to set up, detection algorithms could use some improvements.
reviewDescription: The picture quality is clear, the PTZ tracking speed is decent, but the detection leaves a bit to be desired with many false positives such as light through a window on the carpet triggering the person detection (lowest sensitivity) after completely disabling motion detection. That’s my only real complaint. Everything else is excellent and I love that there’s no recurring cloud subscription and that I can locally store recordings without additional accessories such as an NVR or hub. These cameras are very easy to set up and the Kasa app does a very good job walking through the setup procedure.

reviewTitle: Very Rough Start, but ironed out problem
reviewDescription: The other negative reviews are accurate about trying to set this thing up. Upon turning it on and following the Kasa app instructions step by step, the camera went from blinking green and orange, to solid red. The app said to Reset the camera. For 10 minutes I looked over every millimeter of the camera and couldn't find the Reset button. So as a last ditch idea I decided to manually rotate the camera ball upwards, because I already knew that's where you insert the SD Card, but rotating it while it was on seemed like a very bad idea for the motor. But wouldn't you know it, the Reset button was right next to the SD Card slot. I held it down for 5 seconds, and it cycled its power off and then back on, and then it started working properly by successfully connecting to my home WiFi. Like other people I was ready to give up and just return it. The Kasa app doesn't say anything about where to find the Reset button on your particular model of camera. If they did that would have saved me 10 minutes of frustration.

So, I do security cameras for other folks as part of my job, but I needed an inexpensive, basic camera for inside my own home. This camera does well. Noise and motion detection is good (sometimes too good - it catches reflections real easy!). Yes, you can hear the motor when it turns, so, a little less quality build encasing the motor, but for the price - hey, that's reasonable (so 4 stars). The tracker gets bored quickly and resets to home. There are multiple features on this camera, like the patrol mode and zone monitoring that seem like they might be GREAT features. Frankly, I'm just too lazy to go through all the learning curves to deal with that (and the added features are not overly "user friendly" - and if that's the case for me, that means it's not pleasant for the average user, so a bonus, but a waste unless you want to take the time to learn it all). My living room is not large enough to need the full 360deg, and its noise detection can tell if someone's coming from off-screen. It does recognize people (which substituted the patrol mode for me). Great for night vision. Not obnoxious in size. Not intrusive. It's app is pretty basic - just like every other app out there but I DO like NO subscription fees just to "use" it (there may be some to store to the cloud?). It may have ads, but I haven't noticed. I did buy my own SD card, got the class 10, 256 GB high fidelity card, and ran this at 2k. Quality was GREAT. I tried 1080. Quality was still amazing. I went down to the 720... and quality was STILL great (but not for face recognition in low light). I'm not looking more than 25 - 30 feet away and the details are MORE than sufficient, giving me even longer record times before it overwrites. It doesn't always alert me on the app when it sees motion, that is touch and go? Maybe a network issue. I did have a 1-time loss of wifi with router at the very beginning, but that remedied itself. (and sometimes, it is slow to connect - but that is all network dependent, not necessarily the camera). Long story short - if someone's breaking into your home, you want to know immediately. You want faces. And, you want to be able to report it. This does that and well enough for the price (in fact, it just beeped at me thru my phone while sitting at work and typing this). Again, it's in the $30 - $40 range... so it's not going to be "high class". But, to get to that range, you're "usually" jumping into the $200-1200+ per camera category, so... for my tight budget, no. It has some mounting options, nothing fancy (like all others in this price range). It's corded, but you can always find solutions for that (and it's not a hidden cam, so cord doesn't really matter, and no battery powered cam will give you good, constant operations without fast draining). Funny note - it picked up motion on our TV screen while binging Supernatural! As an IT person who does camera set-up security, if you're on a budget, I recommend this. I was going to get a Hiseeu cam because of their quality build, but honestly, the Kasa has audio detection, better audio quality, near the same range of vertical motion, does not have to be mounted up-side down (can sit on its base), is smaller / less obvious, does well at night, does lack the "emergency lights" option (unless I'm mistaken, someone please correct me), and has a "patrol" mode (which, if you've ever used 360 degree cameras, you suddenly realize that it can't see someone coming from a blind spot and becomes obnoxiously useless without a patrol mode and/or audio detection) - and altogether, even tho the Hiseeu motor is quiet and the build is stronger (and it can pair with an NVR whereas I have no idea if the Kasa can), that STILL makes Kasa the better option for me (on a budget).

reviewDescription: We recently hired a new petsitter. First time a stranger is used w/our pets. I wanted to scrutinize her behavior w/pets & time of arrival needed 2x daily. The audio in this isnt that great but frankly the video is pretty decent. I told my bestie about it, shes got 2 cats as well. (I always wanted one really to see just what our younger & freshest was up to.) it definitely was a great value for what i got in video. I opted out of Cloud svs & bought a MicroSD 128GB card. It saw my wifi network easily. I downloaded the KASA app off Google as directed first. Plugged it in, it was super easy (intuitive software). Just buy it, im gonna buy another for the bedroom where our oldest resides. This first one is between dining & living rooms and in its 180 degs sweep, it catches all counters, dining table and very importantly, the 3 main door entrances from outside! Sound isn't great, but we don't really need it to be - we don't talk to the dog through the camera.It was hard to find the right place for this to give the broadest possible view of the room. We finally put it on a shelf in a corner and it covers most of the room, but there are hiding places. Higher on a wall or on the ceiling it would probably show the whole room.The app is good - simple and easy to use. The only thing I dislike about it is when you get the "person detected" alert and tap it to go to the app, the app assumes you want to see the recording rather than the live feed. reviewTitle: Notifications must be manually turned on/off, Inconvenient
reviewDescription: For the price point, this is a great quality camera. The night vision is above average and the video quality is not choppy, but quite smooth. There are some nice features attached to this camera like being able to create certain zones that you want to be monitored and it has a wide pan. Unfortunately, I do not have the same schedule every day and there is absolutely no way for this camera to turn on/off notifications based on location. There is no way to arm/disarm this camera when you leave home/arrive home besides manually opening the app and toggling notifications on/off. If you are somebody that has the same exact schedule seven days a week, you could in the settings specify what time you would like to receive notifications. I don’t know one person in my life that has the exact same schedule every single day of the week. This is extremely inconvenient and why I returned the camera. I was looking to replace a Wyze camera around the same price point that has been having some video quality playback issues lately. I would rather keep the Wyze camera that has occasional playback issues because I can use the third-party app IFTTT to automatically turn on/off notifications when I leave a specified area, or return to a specified area. This makes it so I never have to open the app unless I am notified of motion/sound. Alternatively, this Kasa camera, while I am at home, is notifying me every five minutes of sound or motion. Needless to say, extremely annoying. I have many smart strips and smart plugs made by Kasa that work great, but this camera was a HUGE letdown. If Kasa could incorporate someway to enable/disable notifications based on location, this would be a 10/10, amazing camera. Until that happens, I cannot recommend this camera to others.

Bought the Kasa 2K QHD camera in 2021 and I've always considered its motion tracking to be sub-par.  When I saw this new 2023 version, I decided to buy it with the hope that Kasa's motion tracking technology had improved.  Unfortunately, just the opposite happened.  Motion tracking on this camera doesn't work at all.  I can stand directly in front of the camera and very slowly move to the right or left and the camera never follows me.  I tried re-setting and everything, nothing changed.  This camera is definitely a step backwards when it comes to performance.
La cámara funciona bien, pero es triste saber que no cuenta con los protocolos rtsp ni onvif, lo que obliga al usuario a manejarla únicamente desde la aplicación del fabricante. Desepcionado.

I've had 2 of these EC70 cameras for a while.  To capture video, you need to purchase and install a separate memory card - costs about $15.  The camera function is good but the FW and app need a lot of work.  The app always complains the cameras are out of sync with my iPhone.  I've spent hours with tech support.  It's clear they have no idea how to fix this.  They'll have you reboot the phone, change your time zone, delete the app and reinstall, etc.  Nothing helps.  However, this doesn't prevent the camera and app from working - just a nuisance warning that you need to click through.  The motion detection feature allows you to create up to 4 regions in the camera's field of view to watch for motion.  It also allows you to adjust the motion sensitivity.  However, these controls do not work correctly as the camera will frequently detect motion outside the defined regions and fail to detect motion within the defined regions.  Also, when you review the captured motion event, the app will frequently skip 15 seconds of the actual motion event.  Opening the app and switching between cameras always results in a delay of 5 to 30 seconds.  I've had my cameras for 5 months now and there have been zero FW updates.  I have several other Kasa devices that work very well.

My intent was to set up an Alexa routine that would play a noise or adjust lights when motion was detected (in this case I wanted it to detect my puppy by the door so I could be notified by Alexa to let him out). Within the first 24 hours mine was accessed. How do I know? reviewTitle: No desktop app, poor video formatting, chat support doesn't know the product
reviewDescription: PROS: Great image quality.CONS: There is no software to monitor the cams from your desktop. MAJOR loss there  The android app takes forever to load, find the cam, load the image and finally display the image.  The recordings on the SD card are apparently hard-coded to be saved in one-minute slices. When I am reviewing the previous nights recordings, I don't want to have to open 60 files to review one hour of footage. Seriously?  The SD card slot is hidden under the camera ball. To access it you have to rotate the camera around then raise it up. Seriously awkward placement.I'll be returning it and avoiding this company in the future. I was really hoping they would work out since I wanted to get up to 4 cams, but I am NOT going to try and monitor four cameras on a cell phone screen. Seriously, who at T-Link/Kasa thought THAT was a good idea. It honestly never occurred to me that a company would promote itself as selling security cameras and NOT have a desktop app. I would have expected better from Fisher-Price, even.Even without the desktop app I was willing to try and use it until I saw that the recordings are 1 minute long and apparently that can't be corrected. I was told that the recording could be up to five minutes, but this same support person told me that I can't record 24/7 which I had already been doing for days. Don't rely on the support...On a related topic I bought this cam to get away from the camera app MIPC which -- while pretty bad -- does at least exist (so it's better that T-Links version -- that doesn't exist). The MIPC is unstable, partially labelled in Chinese (more of an amusement than a problem), has the user go through many extra steps to view their footage (which it conveniently stores in 1-hour files).Summary: Unless you enjoy scanning through dozens (maybe hundreds) of files to review your security footage, and want to monitor up to four cameras on a tiny screen, while getting support that seems to not know the product any better than the purchaser, avoid this product and probably the entire T-Link/Kasa product line. I have to assume that all their products have this same lack of forethought and support.

reviewTitle: Features cost money, or don't exist. Useless as security.
reviewDescription: So, I've used this camera for a while now, and I gotta say, its quite awful. Its slow to track motion, it reacts to motion like after the motion has passed. It only gives a picture of something if you pay $3/m per camera and even then its not all that great.Otherwise, you have to spend 5 minutes loading the camera in your app because the app is absolutely horrible. Even if you're on the same wifi network as the camera it still takes forever, as if it first has to go through the internet which is unreasonably stupid and I have high speed, at this speed it should be instantaneous access.Worse yet, the app only lets you snap a photo, you aren't allowed to record what it sees. You can't pull recorded history either. You can view it, if you have an SD card in the camera, but you can't pull a video clip from it. For that, you'll have to shut down the camera, pull the card, move it to a computer, find the file names you want and combine them all in some video editor. The camera records things in 60 second chunks and stores them in a folder named for the hour, in a folder named for the day. Which is fine and all, but the Kasa app, does not let you easily  get the video clip yourself. They make you have to pay for such things because you only get a record button if you are a Kasa Care member.As a result of this, and the Kasa app being so terrible, I will never be  getting anything Kasa related again. I already use their smart lights and this app, is just so bad, even they are sluggish with it. This camera proves to me that Kasa don't care about the customers. The camera its self is great, but feature locked and feature lacking which makes it, useless. I wish I could return this but, eh.Side note, the camera has a tendency to burn out your MicroSD cards permanently if you have power flow issues, such as living in a stormy area where the power can go out or flicker multiple times within a short period of time. This camera has already burnt out one SD card of mine permanently.

reviewTitle: Live Stream cuts out every 10 minutes or so...
reviewDescription: As a camera, it's not bad if you don't plan to live stream with it. For a 2K picture, I expected better. It's a little grainy, but for a baby monitor, it was something I could live with. Its remote control feature is ok. It's just a little loud when the camera is moving and there is a slight delay.WHY I RETURNED IT: I wanted a simple camera with audio, night vision, and a decent picture. I wasn'tplanning to record anything. I really just wanted to be able to live stream so I could watch my baby when I was in another room. How simple, right? Well, the live stream cuts out every 10 minutes or so to ask if you are still watching. When I select that I am still watching, it takes 30+ seconds sometimes for the stream to resume and focus so I can see my baby again. Sometimes, I have to restart the app to reconnect. I contacted TP-link to see how I could disable this feature. They told me, "well the camera has motion sensors and cry detection, etc. so you don't need to live stream. It will let you know if there is movement, then you can open the app to view what's going on" (after 30+ seconds). When I asked about the delay they told me it was probably my network. Now I'm a very experienced IT person and my home network is more solid than most small business networks, easily. It's fast and there is not a single dead spot on my property. So, that's s not the issue. In the end, they chalked it up to, "that's just how the camera was designed". So, I'm sending it back until they design a better one. I can get a basic webcam that will do a better job for my needs.Another thing I am annoyed with is, the camera can't be shared with another user. My wife set it up under her Kasa account, so I have to log out of my Kasa app and log in with her credentials on my phone to use the darn thing...This camera has potential, but the basic functionality is completely terrible.

reviewTitle: Lacking features in comparison to competition
reviewDescription: This camera is basic af.  The picture quality is great but that should be expected in this day and age when in general, most devices are rendering video in at least 1080.The irritation sets in with the need to force the user to get a subscription to make the camera at all useful.  You cannot use a microSD card to store any video clips that are detected via motion.  Nearly every camera has this - and at the same price point - these days.  It makes no sense that you can only use a microSD card for 24/7 recording.  It seems they did this to justify the subscription.From the looks of it, other than being able to use the camera like every other normal camera is used (Blink, Wyze, Ring, Nest to name a few) - that is, to record any motions detected by the camera instead of blindly recording everything- their subscription service doesn’t even offer any basic perks.  IE They do not offer AI recognition such as Pets, People, Friendly Faces/People You Know, Audio Sounds such as baby crying, meowing, barking, window smashing.  Nada.  They don’t offer you to set a schedule of when to record (there is a schedule set to “patrol” but again, useless because all that does is move the camera back and forth).I am sending this back and getting something else.  Two stars for an easy setup and good picture quality.  The app is pretty much sucks otherwise.

If id know you had another outdoor specific model i would have bought that.Another thing to be aware of..its meant to be wall mountable..fair enough...but the camera is unable to look upwards at a90 angle, so you 'can' mount it on the wall, so long as your ok with it only seeing the floor.Quite shocked that this camera has fallen to being lesser than a cheap ali version i also own, which can look upwards, has a speaker that makes recognisable noise, and has seemingly more advanced ai tracking (including sound tracking from two mics).This cam is unfortunately a bit of a dud.Doorbell is good, this cam not so much (and its widget is still not working, only for the doorbell).Can also add that is unable to hold a recorded position and so the patrol mode is useless. You leave it patrolling overnight and by morning all the saved positions are about 10°-20° out of alignment. It spends most of the time looking at a wall now.

reviewTitle: Excellent value for a very versatile and feature packed remote camera.
reviewDescription: These cameras are excellent! The price paid is minimal compared to the total amount of functionality.They do track objects that trigger them, maybe not as smoothly as higher priced options (I don’t know, have not tried others).For the mobility of relocating the  camera by simply picking it up and finding a new location, it’s massively more practical than the full wired systems available.  Until you know where you want those more expensive cameras to be permanently installed, these cameras are a great alternative!  Also, great for keeping a watch on who’s passing by your place at window-level.Wired cameras have to be mounted high enough to be safe from getting ripped down by trespassers, these see through windows during the day very well.  Interior night vision is top notch, seeing outside through windows at night is more difficult.With the sensitivity turned up, every time a tree branch blows it triggers the cameras.  This leads to near constant triggering of alerts during the late Spring, Summer and early Fall.And, lots of recordings every day.  So, you need to use the App to designate areas to watch for motion, or it’ll drive you nuts and frustrate you. To the point that you may start to ignore the notices.The App provides great control, and allows remote on/off, sensitivity setting changes, you can set to record noise triggers or remove that, set trigger zones, move the camera via the App, and other adjustments.I have noticed that the App actually does offer more functions, and work a little more smoothly, through my phone than my very new tablet. No idea why, it should be the same App for both platforms, no?But, of course watching the playback on the larger screen is so much better, so I do use both.The service plan allows storage of recordings from up to 10 cameras for $10 per month.  Much more cost effective than others I looked into.The cons:Can’t see thru glass with the built-in lights, at night. Reflection off the glass blinds the camera.That should have been obvious to me from the start, since these are designed for indoor use only.  but I had naively hoped for better night vision performance.So, if looking out a window, get a motion-activated light to trigger so you can see what’s going on out there. Just don’t set it up where it will shine in your bedroom and wake you up.App functionality on phone is higher than on tablet, no idea why.  You will want to have the App on at least a phone, if not both.Sometimes, some cameras will trigger, others won’t, for the same event.Deer moving around the house sometimes are ignored by one camera, recorded by another.  Also happened that another outdoor camera from another manufacturer recorded a vehicle trespassing, these cameras didn’t. Had to adjust the sensor sensitivity, but I think the baseline software settings should be set to trigger sooner on vehicles.Branches moving on the breeze cause constant notices, even with Person Detection Mode activated.A more elaborate software system might offer better monitoring, but for the pro systems, this requires fully wired systems with dedicated main recording components/control systems .  Much more expensive, and I can’t afford to open the walls throughout the property.Overall, these are great! I have bought several models, both the fixed ones and the bigger moving ones.  All look great when set to the highest recording resolution, seem to last a long time, and are a breeze to set up or switch from spot to spot.I very much recommend this camera!  I also hope the manufacturer can produce a 4K version.
I love these cameras.  I like them better than the blink mini white camera . Great quality and sound is great .

I use this camera to spy on my cats while I’m out of the house. I love that I can control it from my phone and see all angles of my apartment. It was really easy to setup. I can hear all noises and choose to get notified of any sounds or movement. I can see everything clearly during the day and the night vision works perfectly.

Really annoyed. I spent an hour with one of their tech people. We tried 3 different phones, and this device didn't work. My spectrum wifi works amazingly well and was working great over the hour period I talked to their tech support. Really a let down and waste of time.

Great camera while it lasted! Used probably 5 times and then it never turned on again. I tried resetting it and checked the cord and plug and nothing helped. Completely dead. Very disappointed on longevity but was excellent while it lasted.
This is the third one of theses cameras that I have purchased and once again it quit in me. I have been trying to boot it up agsin. But it will not  be recognized when I run the app.

reviewTitle: So hard to activate or install in the app
reviewDescription: Cheap camera, very complicated! It says easy install, not a at all. I bought this to monitor my pet. I will just buy the Ring camera that is so easy to add to the app. Returning it!

reviewTitle: Worked on day #1 - quit a few days later
reviewDescription: Worked on day #1 - quit a few days laterHaven't been able to get it down to figure out what happened
Ordered two of these cameras..and only recieved one...and once i got home,I've tried for hours to get it to connect and it just wont..I'm so frustrated and will nvr order from this company again...
During activation there is a step to connect the camera to your home WiFi and it never connects. I’ve seen others online saying they have the same problem. Don’t get scammed, don’t buy this

Very disappointed, extremely disappointed with this brand. I have several products from them for a while.However, recently, this camera that I actually have 2. stopped working and it has been very difficult and complicated to get a replacement, I just email and do everything they say and it still doesn't work. If they can't send a replacement at least I would like my money back.

reviewTitle: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera
reviewDescription: The sound went off after a couple of months. The sound doesn't reproduce at all. Tried to reset the camera and does not work. Be aware of the problem and don't buy this.

I’m so surprised at the product reviews. I had to troubleshoot it so many times because it just wouldn’t connect to my wifi! I have the ring camera and didn’t have that issue at all. Then when it finally connects it ends up disconnecting over and over again. I guess you get a hat you pay for. I’ll be returning this and looking into a different more reputable brand. Such a waste. However when it was actually connected the picture was clear in all aspects and motion detection was good. However i cannot recommend this product or give a good rating because it just doesn’t won’t stay connected making the product useless to me.

reviewTitle: Two way audio doesn’t work on iphone
reviewDescription: When I first got this I was excited to finally be able to watch my furbabies while at work, the two way audio worked great….. until about a month later. The mic option in the app stopped working, there is zero troubleshooting for it nor any way to contact support to report the issue. After a few months the motion controls in the app became more and more delayed. If I pulled the joy stick to the left, the camera would turn right before turning left. Almost every time I try to swivel the camer I get an error that it has reached its range limit, which is false. I’d have to then turn it the opposite way completely then turn back to where I need and the error would be gone. I started out really liking this, but now after just a few months I’m looking to purchase a different camera completely.Update: went through hoops and hurdles to contact customer service and they only have a very slow email option, only for them to tell me that I need to ship the defective item back before the refund or send me a new one. As if it’s so easy for ever to get up and out to do this, I am disabled and it’s not something easily done for me. So now I’m stuck with something that doesn’t even work. If you have an iPhone, stay away from this product.

reviewTitle: Camera is ok, Kasa software is a disaster, buyer beware
reviewDescription: This review is more about the Kasa application than the Pan/Tilt Camera itself which is a good piece of hardware. Nice clear video, good range of motion. I have over 35 Kasa devices (bulbs/plugs/cameras) linked into my router networks. Power went out, everything down except router on UPS backup along with cable modem. But router did a complete reset anyway. When power came back, all my Kasa devices in the application were gone. Nothing remained. Normally when this happens, all Kasa devices come back on full power. I would then shut them off using the Kasa app. But can't as it no longer recognizes any of my devices. But Alexa still sees them all, and works fine. The Kasa app does not backup its data properly. If it gets nuked, you must relink every device from scratch. As said above I've got nearly 3 dozen. Don't understand why Alexa has all the devices but Kasa nuked them all. Router shows they are all on the network, pingable and communicating. So buyer beware. Kasa app is not stable on the phone. Another demerit goes to its portability to other Apple devices like iPad. When iPhone app was working fine, I loaded Kasa app to my iPad Pro. Came up and did not recognize any of the working devices on the phone. WTH! Why would the app not recognize what's already on the phone? Other apps do this fine. So it will take about a full day of relinking every device. No more TPlink/Kasa stuff for me.

Product title says it works with Home app; This is a lie. As box states, it's only "Hey Google" compatible: no video and a few useless voice commands. So yes, it shows in Home, but as a paperweight device (read as: functionless).Further, even with Kasa app, the device disconnects consistently. Even worse, while disconnected the app just shows the most recent frame as if it were live video!!Overall, I cannot believe this is the "#1 seller" in the category.

Tried for an hour to figure out how to locally store motion detected segments.  I only found that you need to subscribe (Minimum $3 per month) to get cloud storage of these segments.  No local storage other than 24/7 always on.  And, I couldn't even find out how to view recorded videos.  They advertise "Free" trial and 2 day cloud storage.  I couldn't get to it. I don't want my videos stored in the cloud.  At the least, they are deceptive.  At worst, they want $$ per month and cloud storage of my videos.  I will stick with Eufy.

reviewTitle: SCAM - does NOT have color night vision
reviewDescription: This product cost about $10 more than another listing that seems to be the exact same product but without falsely claiming to have color night vision. I contacted Kasa's support number directly to get it resolved and after spending FIFTY MINUTES on the phone "troubleshooting" they finally told me that feature is not offered on any of their cameras. So I asked for a refund and they said I would have to contact Amazon to get one from them instead. Amazon did give me my $10 back, but they shouldn't have had to because this was Kasa's fault for false advertising, and it should have been more than $10 because of how much of my time and energy they (Kasa) wasted pretending this was an issue with me just not knowing how to set it up correctly.

reviewTitle: I can’t stand this thing. Constant issues, constantly having to reset
reviewDescription: Update to the review below.I’ve had to reset this camera a few times now. It’ll keep running into issues, like 24 hour recording decided to stop working. The LED status light came on once (I did not turn it on, nor did I want it on). The only time that you can successfully format the sd card is after a reset (otherwise, it just spins and winds up showing  less memory than it had before it tried to format). The camera randomly panned back and forth a few times again the other day (I do not have zones set up for it to patrol). Since the last time I reset it, it goes back and forth between detecting phantom motion and not detecting actual motion. I know I’m forgetting other minor annoyances.I’ve contacted the company and am hoping that they’ll be able to help me out. If not, this thing is going in the trash.Original reviewPros: it has a decent picture quality, even in low light (without night mode turned on).Cons: the picture quality isn’t quite what I’d hoped for. It’s not clear enough to get license plates, not clear enough to get an ID on people trying to break into cars.The software is awful. The only videos that you can download directly are cloud videos. If you want to save a video from the sd card, you’ll need to screen record it.I woke up one day to the camera spinning around like the Exorcist and had to reset it.Just today, it decided that it’s not going to record/show cloud videos. I’m hoping that will resolve itself and I won’t have to reset the camera again.

reviewTitle: Waste of Money and Poor Customer Support
reviewDescription: I recently purchased this camera and have been having issues with the sound detection right out of the box. It's impossible to turn on the "Listen for Sound" setting or adjust the sensitivity of the "Detect Baby Crying"  because every time you try to adjust these basic settings in their app, you receive a "request failed" error (as pictured). I've reached out to Kasa's tech support multiple times and they rarely respond. If they do respond back, it's with the same scripted garbage that shows that they have no clue how to fix the issue.I really wanted to rate this camera high because the video is decent and the other notifications are great. Despite that, the company advertises this camera as one that allows local storage but they misleadingly hide the convenience of downloading a video to your phone, by forcing you to pay for a storage plan.Even worse, when you go through the trouble of removing the memory card you're using to store footage locally, when you plug the memory card into your computer, there's zero sound with any of the video files (which are all "conveniently" stored in a million folders that are created for every minute of every hour of every day).

reviewTitle: Stopped working after a few months
reviewDescription: These cameras were the best but for some reason they just stopped working one by one just a couple of months after buying. They show in the app as no longer connected to the internet but the when I log in to my router I can see them connected. I tried resetting them and it stays looping on establishing connection in the app and won’t complete the set up. Yet, I can see them getting added to the internet on my router. I even factory reset my internet and change the credentials, I had to remove every single device that was connected to my internet to do that. Even after that, it didn’t work. Finally, I had a brand new of these cameras still in the box, which I had not have the time to install yet and I tried setting that one up and the same issue. I think they are trying to phase out these cheaper ones, but they shouldn’t just stop supporting it like that after I spent hundreds buying over 10 cameras. Very disappointing. Sadly, since it has been month, I can’t return or exchange them, but I will surely never again buy this brand and I don’t recommend it. Poor business practice.

reviewTitle: Won't connect anymore after last update
reviewDescription: I have 2 Kasa cameras plus smart plugs that all started having issues the other day during an update. Now, none of the devices will connect back to my wifi and are useless, including a smart plug that is for my aquarium that needs CO2 on a timer so I'm pretty pissed that this product can't get itself working after a simple update. reviewTitle: Stopped Working - less than a year!

reviewTitle: nice pan tilt camera for basic baby cam stuff
reviewDescription: nice pan tilt camera for the price. No zoom.I would give it an additional star if it had integration with SmartThings.
The camera works for what it is needed for.The view options are a little weird but it is ok

reviewTitle: Love the product but was sent the wrong device

Ordered again and was accidentally sent the kasa spot instead. Not a huge issue since it was needed immediately but just something to look out for.

Sometimes I’ll have to completely exit out of the app in order to be able to see anything.Besides that, set up was easy. Picture quality is great. Night vision is pretty cool and really good. You don’t know how much my heart jumps at times when it says a person in the a room when I know for a fact that isn’t true. I have these mainly to observe my cats habits. I have two Wyze cameras that can tell the difference. It will tell me if it sees a pet or person.
I love that I am able to check my home's activity while I am away. I only wish the camera could go lower to see directly in front of it. But other than that it works really well.

reviewTitle: Camera is great, piece was missing though.
reviewDescription: We have two of these cameras and they are very good quality, even in night mode. They are indoor but we have them outdoor (covered and out of weather) and have not had any complaints. The app is super easy to use and set up. The mounting piece was missing on this camera, which sucks, but would not prevent me from buying again!

I needed a camera so I could keep an eye on my dog for long work days. This was a great price (cant beat it) and had good reviews so i decided to get it. I dont have anything to compare it to but it works well and what i beed it to do. I get notifications when theres motion or barking which is what i really wanted it for. reviewTitle: DOES NOT WORK WITH GOOGLE HOME
reviewDescription: the camera works well as a stand alone with the Kasa App but it does not work with Google home as indicted in the description.  It does work with the Google Nest hub but the picture is blurry and you cannot move the camera there.  If you’re buying it for Google home use, it won’t work. Otherwise it’s a good camera for the price.

reviewTitle: Seems to work pretty well with App, but unreliable with Google Nest & Chromecast displays
reviewDescription: I followed all of the instructions and FAQs for installing the camera on the App and with Google Home.  The camera seems to work well when using the App.  I was able to view video, the picture looked very clear, and I could point the camera as needed.I was also able to view video using our Google Hub Max display and our Chromecast on our TV, however it was unreliable with both of those devices.  Around 50% of the time when asking to view the camera it either would not start up the camera, or else the camera would give the error "Oops!  Something went wrong with the camera stream.  Please try again.  If issue persists, please contact customer support for further assistance."  I'm fairly sure I configured it correctly because it would work about 50% of the time, but it was too frustrating to only have it work half the time as sometimes you might have to restart it 2-5 times in a row.I read the FAQs for the camera and did everything they suggested there.  I also contacted TP-Link support who had me reboot my router but that did not fix the problem.Conclusion:  Good image quality camera and seems to work well with it's own app.  But at least at this time it doesn't seem to work well with the Google devices for displaying the camera (for me anyway).  Perhaps a future update of their software might fix this, but for right now it didn't work reliably for me, bad enough that sadly I'm returning it.In addition with the Google displays it will only view the camera for 10 minutes before stopping.  Apparently with the App (if it's on the same WiFi) you can have continuous viewing, but with the Google displays it will only view for 10 minutes before stopping.

reviewTitle: Misleading Information about Maximum Size of MicroSD Card
reviewDescription: The Information on this site indicates that the Kasa EC71 Pan-Tilt Security Camera can accommodate upto 256GB micro SD.  On the site, it also has quick links to add a 256GB Micro SD card which I decided to buy as well.  However, after purchasing the SD card, I noticed that the delivery was more than 3 weeks out for the SD Card so I cancelled.  Good thing too.  When I went to a local store to purchase the same, I reviewed the information on the Kasa website and found that the maximum supported micro SD Card size is only 64GB.  I called support for Kasa and confirmed that the Amazon information is incorrect.  Kasa indicate that Amazon placed the information and will work with Amazon to update the information.  Outside of that, the camera seems to work well in first few days operation.  The microSD Card slot along with the reset button is accessible in the rotating ball when you turn the camera up manually by hand with power removed.  I had to use the reset button to clear the WIFI setting when transferring it to another WIFI connection to re-initialize the setup.

As with any electronic, the reviews can be polarized. I have been satisfied with this camera so far! We use it as a baby monitor for my son's room. The night vision is great. The notifications can be personalized (I have it notify me for baby cries and person detection, not motion or other sounds). The range of views is great and ease of changing views is easy. I've been happy with the app too. I bought a 256GB SD card which allows us to go back and look at the camera recordings from the past. Most important thing to emphasize - with the SD card, you can go back and watch recordings without any subscription! You also get notifications without any subscription (with or without an SD card).Only reason I gave this 4 stars- you cannot leave it streaming as a baby monitor. After 10 minutes, the screen times out and asks if you want to keep streaming. With that popup, you won't hear anything. Huge design flaw if you're looking to use it as a baby monitor. We have a sound/video monitor that we used when he was an infant, so we just use that for the monitor purpose when we're sleeping. Overall very happy with the camera. We were disappointed that we couldn't stream it continuously to use as a baby monitor, but since we figured out a work around, we don't mind.

reviewTitle: Works great, can be viewed remotely from anywhere on your phone
reviewDescription: I was thinking that the video feed could only be viewed while at home while on the same wifi network as the camera, but I was very happy to discover that with the app I can view the video feed from anywhere.I also like that the camera can be adjusted left/right and up/down so that once I place it somewhere, I can easily fine tune the angles without having to put shims or something under it to prop it up just right.Night vision is good, and motion detection is good. It even picks up little moths or insects flying by.The only gripe I have is that the date of last motion detection is given in a few different places in the app (the home screen, the 24/7 recording section under the home section, the cameras screen, and the activity screen) but the dates don't always agree with each other. For example, the activity screen will show no activity on days when there are recordings under the 24/7 recording under the home screen. I've found the home screen and the 24/7 recording screen under the home screen to be accurate, so I reference that and ignore the other places activity dates are given.

reviewTitle: Good camera for the price. But make sure to buy a reputable SD card.
reviewDescription: The camera is pretty good. Good quality picture, pretty solid streaming capabilities. Dislike that it breaks the stream up into segments of 3-5 minutes at a time even with a SD card inserted. Also dislike that you can't  batch download selected videos in the app. Makes downloading large parts a pain in the butt when you have to do it one by one. Having to merge all the video files into one large video file is time consuming and can be frustrating. I'd like to see the videos to be one continuous video per hour of 24/7 recordings.
The microphone is broken and have a horrible echo, so hard to talk to and be understood 😩 thinking to return it

reviewTitle: Work via remote access with Starlink satellite
reviewDescription: Looked at a lot of reviews for a number of different security cameras. Conclusion: everyone dislikes everyone else favorite security camera/system.  So went low-risk and got this camera.  It's interior only; requires a hardwired electric plug.  No monthly fees.  And...it worked with the Starlink router without issue.  I was concerned I was going to have an issue with the communication ports, since Starlink router is locked down and much of the configuration is inaccessible, but apparently the default TCP port, inbound and outbound, were open.  Setup was easy with the iPhone app - which was all I needed to get it setup.  One note: during the setup I didn't realize I had to connect to the cameras "wi-fi" network by switching away from the Starlink one (note: initial setup was all done via local access on the wi-fi).  Once I did this, the Starlink and camera did a wi-fi handshake and I was all set.  I can rotate it 360 and tilt it up and down; has a microphone and can capture sound; takes a 64GB mini-micro card for local storage; can set sensitivities, zones, delays, etc.  Very kewl.  Sends alerts to my phone for motion or sound.  But, without premium service, it seems to be just an alert (although I can screen capture if needed if I'm looking at the live feed).  All this from 40 miles away at our primary residence.  So, for basic monitoring, this is great for the one-time cost of buying the camera - with the possibility of upgrading to an online service for activity logging and video capture.

So, the description mentions support of up to 256GB SD card. I put my 128gb card in and it didn't detect it. Also, it doesn't tpan down as far as I would like, so I have to find a new position for this camera which is limited because of my apartment. Ultimately, I'd like to give it a 3.5, but I'll give it a 4 because the picture quality and night vision recording is great. The app is also easy to use compared to the last camera I bought. For the price? Great buy, just make sure you get an SD card no bigger than 64gb!

I was afraid they would be difficult to set up so I waited for my son.  Totally unnecessary!!!  Download the App and set up was a breeze.  The motion detected really follows motion.  The night vision is awesome quality.  I get notified on my phone if motion or a person was detected.  It actually distinguished the difference.  Did not expect any of this at the price point. reviewTitle: SD card ends up broken because of this camera
reviewDescription: Got the camera and installed the SD card. Camera reformats the SD card for you. After setting up the camera I tried to watch the recorded clips. The app tells me there is no SD card installed. To get to the SD card you need to tilt the camera up to reveal the SD card slot. The camera wouldn't tilt up to get to it. Turns out the SD card ejected on its own while the camera was facing down and jammed up the camera from moving up and down. The support team couldn't seem to understand that it was jammed up and I couldn't get to the SD card and told me to just remove the SD card and see if it would auto eject again. The SD card ended up broken and the camera unjammed.
Camera gets stuck in odd positions - pointing at the wall. Doesn't pick up motion as it should all the time.
The only problem i have is it’s a little slow to pan around but that’s the only small complaint I have about it

reviewTitle: Good for the price but not ideal
reviewDescription: We have four of these cameras that we use indoors for security and to watch our pets when we’re not at home. For the very affordable price I paid, i’m happy enough with these cameras, but there are some key features that I would gladly pay more for. First of all they don’t connect fully to Alexa. I can only turn them on and off from the Kasa app, and I would rather be able to control them by voice using Alexa. I have gotten around this by plugging them into smart plugs that do respond to Alexa, and then naming the plugs accordingly. This is also how I solve the problem of the cameras, lacking Geo fencing capabilities. I wanted the cameras to turn on automatically when I leave the house, and turn off when I get home, so I programmed Alexa to operate the plugs.As far as tracking and panning go, the cameras work well as long as something passes in front of them that they can then follow. The problem comes in when they end up pointed in a corner, and all the action is happening on the opposite side of the room, where they can’t see it. Even though I have sound detection turned on, they never seem to pick up the hint to look in a different direction.My biggest frustration is when I want to view history in the recordings. I have SD cards in every camera so they can record 24/7. The problem is that the camera history cannot be scrubbed to see a specific moment in time. It jumps by five minute intervals. Meaning if something occurred at 3:29, I have to go back to 3:25 and wait four minutes for the video to play through before I can get to the event. If I want to watch it again, I have to go back to 3:25 and wait four more minutes. This is incredibly frustrating. With my more expensive cameras from another brand, I can scrub the video easily to get to the exact minute and second that I want to see. The frustration is enough that I might be replacing these cameras soon with a different brand that gives me that basic functionality.

reviewTitle: Here's a crucial tip if you're trying to use a Mac with this cam and a micro SD card...
reviewDescription: I almost sent this Kasa Spot cam back until I learned this tip; thought I would share the tip here in hopes that it helps save others the hassle I went through. I purchased this cam specifically because I wanted to use it to record onto a 256 GB microSD card rather than paying for an iCloud monthly subscription. Set up of the camera with the Kasa app was fairly intuitive and painless. The camera functions as stated and I am happy with the picture quality. When I first inserted the micro SD card in the camera it wanted to format card to ExFAT format (no big deal I assumed). I didn't think anything of it until I tried to plug the micro SD card into my MacBook Pro to look at the recordings. At that point, my Apple laptop said that it did not recognize the micro SD card and that I needed to reformat it. Doing so obviously would delete the recording thus rendering the intended purpose of this camera and micro SD card useless. After much trial and error I decided to try formating the card on DIsk Utility on my Mac as MS-DOS FAT32. I then put the micro SD card back in the camera and much to my surprise the camera accepted the card without trying to reformat it. Then I recorded some more video. To my delight when I plugged the SD card back into the MacBook Pro I was able to retrieve the video from the SD card (the laptop did not try to reformat the card). So if you are trying to do what I am here the solution is to FIRST format the micro SD card using Dick Utility on your Mac to [MS-DOS FAT32] and then use the card with your Kasa Spot cam to make recordings. I nearly sent the whole thing back to Amazon because I didn't think it was going to work but this was finally the solution I needed. I hope this helps save you all the headaches I experienced. Overall this is a good little camera for the price and now that I have figured out how to retrieve the video from the micro SD card on my MacBook Pro I look forward to using it.

reviewTitle: Do you like to watch your house as much as I do?
reviewDescription: So everyone who knows me knows I LOVE to spy on what happening in my house when I am not home. This camera is the BEST. I have 3 set up and I can see the front door, garage and my bedroom. I was so happy I bought one for travel so I can see what happens when I leave my hotel room and Air B&B. So far nothing!

I don't have a lot of experience with this type of camera, but I've been very happy with it so far. The setup is very simple. We already had Kasa products so adding it to the app was even easier. I like that you can use the SD card and not subscribe to a service if you don't want to. I like the other options available with Kasa so we could add a doorbell or outdoor cameras, etc if we want. The video quality seems good to me.The only drawback I have found to the cameras is the location of the electrical adapter jack. If you want to put the camera flush against a wall, you have to turn it so that the camera is pointed to one side. This initial view then becomes sort of the "default" position for the camera. In our case, this means looking at something next to it on a shelf by default. I think either the jack should be moved to take this into account or you should be able to have the ability to reset the "default" viewpoint in the app.The "patrol" feature, which asks the camera to regular look at certain viewpoints you choose, helps eliminate this problem, but you would need to use patrol all day in order to get a view outside of this default. In our case, we mostly want a night view so we set it to patrol at night, but this might not be ideal for others. Since the warning is that patrol can wear down the motor, this is not the best long term solution. If Kasa could adjust this, it would be super helpful.

This review is for the 2K KC410S.Pros:Great low light night visionNice features with patrol mode and motion trackingGreat 2K clarityGreat value for this level of cameraCons:24/7 recording unless you subscribe to service. Fills SD card fast in 2K recording.Weird Viewpoint viewing in patrol mode. You can set 4 viewpoints with 1,2,5 and 10 minute viewing. Problem is that it doesn’t consistently maintain those viewpoints. Especially if you have motion tracking on. It forgets the set viewpoints and sometimes goes to views set previously. Erratic.“Live view” doesn’t really work for more than 10 minutes. My guess is that constant recording overwhelms this feature. It will prompt you to continue live view and if you don’t respond it kicks you out of the app. A workaround is to not do live view from the Devices tab but via the Camera tab. This workaround is not ideal as you don’t get a true “live” view. There are significant delays in what you see. Often it doesn’t show any live activity. However it does capture the recording which you can view. I contacted KASA about this and while the tried to resolve it they didn’t. At least they responded.Limited capacity. The highest SD card is 128gb. Since it records 24/7 it fills up fast, especially at 2K. So you may only have a few days worth of recordings before it overwrites itself. Apparently subscription gives you activity recordings so you only see motion/activity which allows for better storage/playback options.I have this camera setup with an old iPad to provide 24/7 outdoor monitoring. It is not designed for that. It sorta works. Too much activity seems to overwhelm this camera. But hey, for ~$40, it works. Especially the night vision. My security light provides enough lighting that this camera actually sees in color at night! That is a big deal as most cameras go into black and white mode and have grainy pictures. I suspect that if you only wanted to occasionally watch something live or checked in when notified, this camera is ideal. Can’t address the subscription service since I don’t use it. Motion Tracking and Patrol Mode are excellent features that you never find at this price!

reviewTitle: The best camera but too many false alarms
reviewDescription: I have 4 of these. I have tried another popular brand (starts with B) that can be found at big box stores but I like this one way better. It allows you to save entire days worth of footage even when there is no motion detected. It can also listen for sound. I love that it can pan and tilt, unlike battery-operated ones.Only downside is that, as with other camera brands, the motion detection is too good. I'm constantly fielding false alarms on the cameras due to glares from passing cars reflecting on the ceiling through the window, etc. No matter where I point the camera, it seems to happen. I know the app has privacy zones that will ignore motion but it's almost the entire top half of the view and I'm worried I'd miss something if I disable those zones.  I have it pointed more towards the ceiling instead of the floor because my cat always sets it off even though I have it set to ignore animals. With the sensitivity at 1/10 this is still an issue. This is the same for audio alarms as well.  Passing traffic constantly sets it off all night and wakes me up.

reviewTitle: PICK THE CHEAPER ONE FOR AUDIO TO SAVE
reviewDescription: I should of picked the cheaper camera, but thought the 2k one would be better. Unfortunately, the 2k option on the camera does not save recordings to the sd card. So I have to use the video quality of the cheaper camera option for any videos to save. Also, they need more instructions, it took a minute to find the sd card slot, and it wouldn’t read the sd card until I held down the reset button next to the card slot. All in all, the camera is good for the price. 2k quality definitely not needed, so save those few extra dollars and get the cheaper option. You can see very clearly without the 2k. The night vision on this is amazing as well. This has better video quality than baby monitors, trail cameras, and any security cameras I’ve seen. Oh! One more thing. It’s delayed by at least 30 seconds. So any movement is actually a little behind. Other than that, pretty good.

Overall the camera does pretty good for the price. Only complaint I really have is, unless you are standing in the same room as the camera, when you go to use the pan/tilt it is SUPER laggy. Eventually you can get it positioned where you need but but sometimes you have to go back and forth to get it where you want it. I really like that you can preset "Activity Zone" and if you click it, the camera goes straight to that area. Still laggy, but at least it stops where you want it to. I just got this camera to check on my cat throughout the day when im at work or if we go out of town, so for my needs its exactly what i expected. The image quality it fairly decent and the camera picks up sound really well, also the Mic works pretty good.

I will be honest, i had my suspicions about a home camera for $25-30. But, i’ve been very impressed with this camera. The only thing i don’t like is that there is quite a bit of lag when rotating the camera via the app. i’ve been using it for a littlemore than a month and i’m really happy with my purchase.
